t: 2 Chronicles 1
And*p Solomon the son of David was strengthened in his kingdom, and the Lord*s his God was with him, and magnified him exceedingly.
Then*p Solomon spake unto all Israel, to the captains of thousands and of hundreds, and to the judges, and to every governor in all Israel, the chief of the fathers.

So*p Solomon, and all the congregation with him, went to the high place that was at Gibeon; for there was the tabernacle of the congregation of God, which Moses the servant of the Lord*s had made in the wilderness.
But*p the ark of God had David brought up from Kirjathâ€“jearim to the place which David had prepared for it: for he had pitched a tent for it at Jerusalem.
Moreover*p the brasen altar, that Bezaleel the son of Uri, the son of Hur, had made, he put before the tabernacle of the Lord:*s and Solomon and the congregation sought unto it.
And*p Solomon went up thither to the brasen altar before the Lord,*s which was at the tabernacle of the congregation, and offered a thousand burnt offerings upon it.
In*p that night did God appear unto Solomon, and said unto him, Ask what I shall give thee.
And*p Solomon said unto God, Thou hast shewed great mercy unto David my father, and hast made me to reign in his stead.
Now,*p O Lord*s God, let thy promise unto David my father be established: for thou hast made me king over a people like the dust of the earth in multitude.
Give*p me now wisdom and knowledge, that I may go out and come in before this people: for who can judge this thy people, that is so great?

And*p God said to Solomon, Because this was in thine heart, and thou hast not asked riches, wealth, or honour, nor the life of thine enemies, neither yet hast asked long life; but hast asked wisdom and knowledge for thyself, that thou mayest judge my people, over whom I have made thee king:

Wisdom*p and knowledge is granted unto thee; and I will give thee riches, and wealth, and honour, such as none of the kings have had that have been before thee, neither shall there any after thee have the like.
Then*p Solomon came from his journey to the high place that was at Gibeon to Jerusalem, from before the tabernacle of the congregation, and reigned over Israel.
And*p Solomon gathered chariots and horsemen: and he had a thousand and four hundred chariots, and twelve thousand horsemen, which he placed in the chariot cities, and with the king at Jerusalem.
And*p the king made silver and gold at Jerusalem as plenteous as stones, and cedar trees made he as the sycomore trees that are in the vale for abundance.
And*p Solomon had horses brought out of Egypt, and linen yarn: the king's merchants received the linen yarn at a price.

And*p they fetched up, and brought forth out of Egypt a chariot for six hundred shekels of silver, and an horse for an hundred and fifty: and so brought they out horses for all the kings of the Hittites, and for the kings of Syria, by their means.
2 Chronicles 2
And*p Solomon determined to build an house for the name of the Lord,*s and an house for his kingdom.
And*p Solomon told out threescore and ten thousand men to bear burdens, and fourscore thousand to hew in the mountain, and three thousand and six hundred to oversee them.
And*p Solomon sent to Huram the king of Tyre, saying, As thou didst deal with David my father, and didst send him cedars to build him an house to dwell therein, even so deal with me.

Behold,*p I build an house to the name of the Lord*s my God, to dedicate it to him, and to burn before him sweet incense, and for the continual shewbread, and for the burnt offerings morning and evening, on the sabbaths, and on the new moons, and on the solemn feasts of the Lord*s our God. This is an ordinance for ever to Israel.
And*p the house which I build is great: for great is our God above all gods.
But*p who is able to build him an house, seeing the heaven and heaven of heavens cannot contain him? who am I then, that I should build him an house, save only to burn sacrifice before him?

Send*p me now therefore a man cunning to work in gold, and in silver, and in brass, and in iron, and in purple, and crimson, and blue, and that can skill to grave with the cunning men that are with me in Judah and in Jerusalem, whom David my father did provide.
Send*p me also cedar trees, fir trees, and algum trees, out of Lebanon: for I know that thy servants can skill to cut timber in Lebanon; and, behold, my servants shall be with thy servants,
Even*p to prepare me timber in abundance: for the house which I am about to build shall be wonderful great.

And,*p behold, I will give to thy servants, the hewers that cut timber, twenty thousand measures of beaten wheat, and twenty thousand measures of barley, and twenty thousand baths of wine, and twenty thousand baths of oil.
Then*p Huram the king of Tyre answered in writing, which he sent to Solomon, Because the Lord*s hath loved his people, he hath made thee king over them.

Huram*p said moreover, Blessed be the Lord*s God of Israel, that made heaven and earth, who hath given to David the king a wise son, endued with prudence and understanding, that might build an house for the Lord,*s and an house for his kingdom.
And*p now I have sent a cunning man, endued with understanding, of Huram my father's,

The*p son of a woman of the daughters of Dan, and his father was a man of Tyre, skilful to work in gold, and in silver, in brass, in iron, in stone, and in timber, in purple, in blue, and in fine linen, and in crimson; also to grave any manner of graving, and to find out every device which shall be put to him, with thy cunning men, and with the cunning men of my lord David thy father.
Now*p therefore the wheat, and the barley, the oil, and the wine, which my lord hath spoken of, let him send unto his servants:
And*p we will cut wood out of Lebanon, as much as thou shalt need: and we will bring it to thee in floats by sea to Joppa; and thou shalt carry it up to Jerusalem.

And*p Solomon numbered all the strangers that were in the land of Israel, after the numbering wherewith David his father had numbered them; and they were found an hundred and fifty thousand and three thousand and six hundred.
And*p he set threescore and ten thousand of them to be bearers of burdens, and fourscore thousand to be hewers in the mountain, and three thousand and six hundred overseers to set the people a work.
2 Chronicles 3

Then*p Solomon began to build the house of the Lord*s at Jerusalem in mount Moriah, where the Lord*s appeared unto David his father, in the place that David had prepared in the threshingfloor of Ornan the Jebusite.
And*p he began to build in the second day of the second month, in the fourth year of his reign.
Now*p these are the things wherein Solomon was instructed for the building of the house of God. The length by cubits after the first measure was threescore cubits, and the breadth twenty cubits.

And*p the porch that was in the front of the house, the length of it was according to the breadth of the house, twenty cubits, and the height was an hundred and twenty: and he overlaid it within with pure gold.
And*p the greater house he ceiled with fir tree, which he overlaid with fine gold, and set thereon palm trees and chains.
And*p he garnished the house with precious stones for beauty: and the gold was gold of Parvaim.
He*p overlaid also the house, the beams, the posts, and the walls thereof, and the doors thereof, with gold; and graved cherubims on the walls.

And*p he made the most holy house, the length whereof was according to the breadth of the house, twenty cubits, and the breadth thereof twenty cubits: and he overlaid it with fine gold, amounting to six hundred talents.
And*p the weight of the nails was fifty shekels of gold. And he overlaid the upper chambers with gold.
And*p in the most holy house he made two cherubims of image work, and overlaid them with gold.

And*p the wings of the cherubims were twenty cubits long: one wing of the one cherub was five cubits, reaching to the wall of the house: and the other wing was likewise five cubits, reaching to the wing of the other cherub.
And*p one wing of the other cherub was five cubits, reaching to the wall of the house: and the other wing was five cubits also, joining to the wing of the other cherub.
The*p wings of these cherubims spread themselves forth twenty cubits: and they stood on their feet, and their faces were inward.
And*p he made the veil of blue, and purple, and crimson, and fine linen, and wrought cherubims thereon.
Also*p he made before the house two pillars of thirty and five cubits high, and the chapiter that was on the top of each of them was five cubits.
And*p he made chains, as in the oracle, and put them on the heads of the pillars; and made an hundred pomegranates, and put them on the chains.
And*p he reared up the pillars before the temple, one on the right hand, and the other on the left; and called the name of that on the right hand Jachin, and the name of that on the left Boaz.
2 Chronicles 4
Moreover*p he made an altar of brass, twenty cubits the length thereof, and twenty cubits the breadth thereof, and ten cubits the height thereof.
Also*p he made a molten sea of ten cubits from brim to brim, round in compass, and five cubits the height thereof; and a line of thirty cubits did compass it round about.
And*p under it was the similitude of oxen, which did compass it round about: ten in a cubit, compassing the sea round about. Two rows of oxen were cast, when it was cast.

It*p stood upon twelve oxen, three looking toward the north, and three looking toward the west, and three looking toward the south, and three looking toward the east: and the sea was set above upon them, and all their hinder parts were inward.
And*p the thickness of it was an handbreadth, and the brim of it like the work of the brim of a cup, with flowers of lilies; and it received and held three thousand baths.

He*p made also ten lavers, and put five on the right hand, and five on the left, to wash in them: such things as they offered for the burnt offering they washed in them; but the sea was for the priests to wash in.
And*p he made ten candlesticks of gold according to their form, and set them in the temple, five on the right hand, and five on the left.
He*p made also ten tables, and placed them in the temple, five on the right side, and five on the left. And he made an hundred basins of gold.
Furthermore*p he made the court of the priests, and the great court, and doors for the court, and overlaid the doors of them with brass.
And*p he set the sea on the right side of the east end, over against the south.
And*p Huram made the pots, and the shovels, and the basins. And Huram finished the work that he was to make for king Solomon for the house of God;

To*p wit, the two pillars, and the pommels, and the chapiters which were on the top of the two pillars, and the two wreaths to cover the two pommels of the chapiters which were on the top of the pillars;
And*p four hundred pomegranates on the two wreaths; two rows of pomegranates on each wreath, to cover the two pommels of the chapiters which were upon the pillars.
He*p made also bases, and lavers made he upon the bases;
One*p sea, and twelve oxen under it.
The*p pots also, and the shovels, and the fleshhooks, and all their instruments, did Huram his father make to king Solomon for the house of the Lord*s of bright brass.
In*p the plain of Jordan did the king cast them, in the clay ground between Succoth and Zeredah.
Thus*p Solomon made all these vessels in great abundance: for the weight of the brass could not be found out.
And*p Solomon made all the vessels that were for the house of God, the golden altar also, and the tables whereon the shewbread was set;
Moreover*p the candlesticks with their lamps, that they should burn after the manner before the oracle, of pure gold;
And*p the flowers, and the lamps, and the tongs, made he of gold, and that perfect gold;

And*p the snuffers, and the basins, and the spoons, and the censers, of pure gold: and the entry of the house, the inner doors thereof for the most holy place, and the doors of the house of the temple, were of gold.
2 Chronicles 5

Thus*p all the work that Solomon made for the house of the Lord*s was finished: and Solomon brought in all the things that David his father had dedicated; and the silver, and the gold, and all the instruments, put he among the treasures of the house of God.

Then*p Solomon assembled the elders of Israel, and all the heads of the tribes, the chief of the fathers of the children of Israel, unto Jerusalem, to bring up the ark of the covenant of the Lord*s out of the city of David, which is Zion.
Wherefore*p all the men of Israel assembled themselves unto the king in the feast which was in the seventh month.
And*p all the elders of Israel came; and the Levites took up the ark.
And*p they brought up the ark, and the tabernacle of the congregation, and all the holy vessels that were in the tabernacle, these did the priests and the Levites bring up.
Also*p king Solomon, and all the congregation of Israel that were assembled unto him before the ark, sacrificed sheep and oxen, which could not be told nor numbered for multitude.
And*p the priests brought in the ark of the covenant of the Lord*s unto his place, to the oracle of the house, into the most holy place, even under the wings of the cherubims:
For*p the cherubims spread forth their wings over the place of the ark, and the cherubims covered the ark and the staves thereof above.
And*p they drew out the staves of the ark, that the ends of the staves were seen from the ark before the oracle; but they were not seen without. And there it is unto this day.
There*p was nothing in the ark save the two tables which Moses put therein at Horeb, when the Lord*s made a covenant with the children of Israel, when they came out of Egypt.
And*p it came to pass, when the priests were come out of the holy place: (for all the priests that were present were sanctified, and did not then wait by course:

Also*p the Levites which were the singers, all of them of Asaph, of Heman, of Jeduthun, with their sons and their brethren, being arrayed in white linen, having cymbals and psalteries and harps, stood at the east end of the altar, and with them an hundred and twenty priests sounding with trumpets:)

It*p came even to pass, as the trumpeters and singers were as one, to make one sound to be heard in praising and thanking the Lord;*s and when they lifted up their voice with the trumpets and cymbals and instruments of musick, and praised the Lord,*s saying, For he is good; for his mercy endureth for ever: that then the house was filled with a cloud, even the house of the Lord;*s
So*p that the priests could not stand to minister by reason of the cloud: for the glory of the Lord*s had filled the house of God.
2 Chronicles 6
Then*p said Solomon, The Lord*s hath said that he would dwell in the thick darkness.
But*p I have built an house of habitation for thee, and a place for thy dwelling for ever.
And*p the king turned his face, and blessed the whole congregation of Israel: and all the congregation of Israel stood.
And*p he said, Blessed be the Lord*s God of Israel, who hath with his hands fulfilled that which he spake with his mouth to my father David, saying,

Since*p the day that I brought forth my people out of the land of Egypt I chose no city among all the tribes of Israel to build an house in, that my name might be there; neither chose I any man to be a ruler over my people Israel:
But*p I have chosen Jerusalem, that my name might be there; and have chosen David to be over my people Israel.
Now*p it was in the heart of David my father to build an house for the name of the Lord*s God of Israel.
But*p the Lord*s said to David my father, Forasmuch as it was in thine heart to build an house for my name, thou didst well in that it was in thine heart:
Notwithstanding*p thou shalt not build the house; but thy son which shall come forth out of thy loins, he shall build the house for my name.

The*p Lord*s therefore hath performed his word that he hath spoken: for I am risen up in the room of David my father, and am set on the throne of Israel, as the Lord*s promised, and have built the house for the name of the Lord*s God of Israel.
And*p in it have I put the ark, wherein is the covenant of the Lord,*s that he made with the children of Israel.
And*p he stood before the altar of the Lord*s in the presence of all the congregation of Israel, and spread forth his hands:

For*p Solomon had made a brasen scaffold, of five cubits long, and five cubits broad, and three cubits high, and had set it in the midst of the court: and upon it he stood, and kneeled down upon his knees before all the congregation of Israel, and spread forth his hands toward heaven,

And*p said, O Lord*s God of Israel, there is no God like thee in the heaven, nor in the earth; which keepest covenant, and shewest mercy unto thy servants, that walk before thee with all their hearts:
Thou*p which hast kept with thy servant David my father that which thou hast promised him; and spakest with thy mouth, and hast fulfilled it with thine hand, as it is this day.

Now*p therefore, O Lord*s God of Israel, keep with thy servant David my father that which thou hast promised him, saying, There shall not fail thee a man in my sight to sit upon the throne of Israel; yet so that thy children take heed to their way to walk in my law, as thou hast walked before me.
Now*p then, O Lord*s God of Israel, let thy word be verified, which thou hast spoken unto thy servant David.
But*p will God in very deed dwell with men on the earth? behold, heaven and the heaven of heavens cannot contain thee; how much less this house which I have built!
Have*p respect therefore to the prayer of thy servant, and to his supplication, O Lord*s my God, to hearken unto the cry and the prayer which thy servant prayeth before thee:

That*p thine eyes may be open upon this house day and night, upon the place whereof thou hast said that thou wouldest put thy name there; to hearken unto the prayer which thy servant prayeth toward this place.

Hearken*p therefore unto the supplications of thy servant, and of thy people Israel, which they shall make toward this place: hear thou from thy dwelling place, even from heaven; and when thou hearest, forgive.
If*p a man sin against his neighbour, and an oath be laid upon him to make him swear, and the oath come before thine altar in this house;

Then*p hear thou from heaven, and do, and judge thy servants, by requiting the wicked, by recompensing his way upon his own head; and by justifying the righteous, by giving him according to his righteousness.

And*p if thy people Israel be put to the worse before the enemy, because they have sinned against thee; and shall return and confess thy name, and pray and make supplication before thee in this house;
Then*p hear thou from the heavens, and forgive the sin of thy people Israel, and bring them again unto the land which thou gavest to them and to their fathers.

When*p the heaven is shut up, and there is no rain, because they have sinned against thee; yet if they pray toward this place, and confess thy name, and turn from their sin, when thou dost afflict them;

Then*p hear thou from heaven, and forgive the sin of thy servants, and of thy people Israel, when thou hast taught them the good way, wherein they should walk; and send rain upon thy land, which thou hast given unto thy people for an inheritance.

If*p there be dearth in the land, if there be pestilence, if there be blasting, or mildew, locusts, or caterpillers; if their enemies besiege them in the cities of their land; whatsoever sore or whatsoever sickness there be:

Then*p what prayer or what supplication soever shall be made of any man, or of all thy people Israel, when every one shall know his own sore and his own grief, and shall spread forth his hands in this house:

Then*p hear thou from heaven thy dwelling place, and forgive, and render unto every man according unto all his ways, whose heart thou knowest; (for thou only knowest the hearts of the children of men:)
That*p they may fear thee, to walk in thy ways, so long as they live in the land which thou gavest unto our fathers.

Moreover*p concerning the stranger, which is not of thy people Israel, but is come from a far country for thy great name's sake, and thy mighty hand, and thy stretched out arm; if they come and pray in this house;

Then*p hear thou from the heavens, even from thy dwelling place, and do according to all that the stranger calleth to thee for; that all people of the earth may know thy name, and fear thee, as doth thy people Israel, and may know that this house which I have built is called by thy name.

If*p thy people go out to war against their enemies by the way that thou shalt send them, and they pray unto thee toward this city which thou hast chosen, and the house which I have built for thy name;
Then*p hear thou from the heavens their prayer and their supplication, and maintain their cause.

If*p they sin against thee, (for there is no man which sinneth not,) and thou be angry with them, and deliver them over before their enemies, and they carry them away captives unto a land far off or near;

Yet*p if they bethink themselves in the land whither they are carried captive, and turn and pray unto thee in the land of their captivity, saying, We have sinned, we have done amiss, and have dealt wickedly;

If*p they return to thee with all their heart and with all their soul in the land of their captivity, whither they have carried them captives, and pray toward their land, which thou gavest unto their fathers, and toward the city which thou hast chosen, and toward the house which I have built for thy name:
Then*p hear thou from the heavens, even from thy dwelling place, their prayer and their supplications, and maintain their cause, and forgive thy people which have sinned against thee.
Now,*p my God, let, I beseech thee, thine eyes be open, and let thine ears be attent unto the prayer that is made in this place.
Now*p therefore arise, O Lord*s God, into thy resting place, thou, and the ark of thy strength: let thy priests, O Lord*s God, be clothed with salvation, and let thy saints rejoice in goodness.
O*p Lord*s God, turn not away the face of thine anointed: remember the mercies of David thy servant.
2 Chronicles 7
Now*p when Solomon had made an end of praying, the fire came down from heaven, and consumed the burnt offering and the sacrifices; and the glory of the Lord*s filled the house.
And*p the priests could not enter into the house of the Lord,*s because the glory of the Lord*s had filled the Lord's*s house.

And*p when all the children of Israel saw how the fire came down, and the glory of the Lord*s upon the house, they bowed themselves with their faces to the ground upon the pavement, and worshipped, and praised the Lord,*s saying, For he is good; for his mercy endureth for ever.
Then*p the king and all the people offered sacrifices before the Lord.*s
And*p king Solomon offered a sacrifice of twenty and two thousand oxen, and an hundred and twenty thousand sheep: so the king and all the people dedicated the house of God.

And*p the priests waited on their offices: the Levites also with instruments of musick of the Lord,*s which David the king had made to praise the Lord,*s because his mercy endureth for ever, when David praised by their ministry; and the priests sounded trumpets before them, and all Israel stood.

Moreover*p Solomon hallowed the middle of the court that was before the house of the Lord:*s for there he offered burnt offerings, and the fat of the peace offerings, because the brasen altar which Solomon had made was not able to receive the burnt offerings, and the meat offerings, and the fat.
Also*p at the same time Solomon kept the feast seven days, and all Israel with him, a very great congregation, from the entering in of Hamath unto the river of Egypt.
And*p in the eighth day they made a solemn assembly: for they kept the dedication of the altar seven days, and the feast seven days.

And*p on the three and twentieth day of the seventh month he sent the people away into their tents, glad and merry in heart for the goodness that the Lord*s had shewed unto David, and to Solomon, and to Israel his people.
Thus*p Solomon finished the house of the Lord,*s and the king's house: and all that came into Solomon's heart to make in the house of the Lord,*s and in his own house, he prosperously effected.
And*p the Lord*s appeared to Solomon by night, and said unto him, I have heard thy prayer, and have chosen this place to myself for an house of sacrifice.
If*p I shut up heaven that there be no rain, or if I command the locusts to devour the land, or if I send pestilence among my people;

If*p my people, which are called by my name, shall humble themselves, and pray, and seek my face, and turn from their wicked ways; then will I hear from heaven, and will forgive their sin, and will heal their land.
Now*p mine eyes shall be open, and mine ears attent unto the prayer that is made in this place.
For*p now have I chosen and sanctified this house, that my name may be there for ever: and mine eyes and mine heart shall be there perpetually.
And*p as for thee, if thou wilt walk before me, as David thy father walked, and do according to all that I have commanded thee, and shalt observe my statutes and my judgments;
Then*p will I stablish the throne of thy kingdom, according as I have covenanted with David thy father, saying, There shall not fail thee a man to be ruler in Israel.
But*p if ye turn away, and forsake my statutes and my commandments, which I have set before you, and shall go and serve other gods, and worship them;

Then*p will I pluck them up by the roots out of my land which I have given them; and this house, which I have sanctified for my name, will I cast out of my sight, and will make it to be a proverb and a byword among all nations.
And*p this house, which is high, shall be an astonishment to every one that passeth by it; so that he shall say, Why hath the Lord*s done thus unto this land, and unto this house?

And*p it shall be answered, Because they forsook the Lord*s God of their fathers, which brought them forth out of the land of Egypt, and laid hold on other gods, and worshipped them, and served them: therefore hath he brought all this evil upon them.
2 Chronicles 8
And*p it came to pass at the end of twenty years, wherein Solomon had built the house of the Lord,*s and his own house,
That*p the cities which Huram had restored to Solomon, Solomon built them, and caused the children of Israel to dwell there.
And*p Solomon went to Hamathâ€“zobah, and prevailed against it.
And*p he built Tadmor in the wilderness, and all the store cities, which he built in Hamath.
Also*p he built Bethâ€“horon the upper, and Bethâ€“horon the nether, fenced cities, with walls, gates, and bars;

And*p Baalath, and all the store cities that Solomon had, and all the chariot cities, and the cities of the horsemen, and all that Solomon desired to build in Jerusalem, and in Lebanon, and throughout all the land of his dominion.
As*p for all the people that were left of the Hittites, and the Amorites, and the Perizzites, and the Hivites, and the Jebusites, which were not of Israel,
But*p of their children, who were left after them in the land, whom the children of Israel consumed not, them did Solomon make to pay tribute until this day.
But*p of the children of Israel did Solomon make no servants for his work; but they were men of war, and chief of his captains, and captains of his chariots and horsemen.
And*p these were the chief of king Solomon's officers, even two hundred and fifty, that bare rule over the people.

And*p Solomon brought up the daughter of Pharaoh out of the city of David unto the house that he had built for her: for he said, My wife shall not dwell in the house of David king of Israel, because the places are holy, whereunto the ark of the Lord*s hath come.
Then*p Solomon offered burnt offerings unto the Lord*s on the altar of the Lord,*s which he had built before the porch,

Even*p after a certain rate every day, offering according to the commandment of Moses, on the sabbaths, and on the new moons, and on the solemn feasts, three times in the year, even in the feast of unleavened bread, and in the feast of weeks, and in the feast of tabernacles.

And*p he appointed, according to the order of David his father, the courses of the priests to their service, and the Levites to their charges, to praise and minister before the priests, as the duty of every day required: the porters also by their courses at every gate: for so had David the man of God commanded.
And*p they departed not from the commandment of the king unto the priests and Levites concerning any matter, or concerning the treasures.
Now*p all the work of Solomon was prepared unto the day of the foundation of the house of the Lord,*s and until it was finished. So the house of the Lord*s was perfected.
Then*p went Solomon to Ezionâ€“geber, and to Eloth, at the sea side in the land of Edom.

And*p Huram sent him by the hands of his servants ships, and servants that had knowledge of the sea; and they went with the servants of Solomon to Ophir, and took thence four hundred and fifty talents of gold, and brought them to king Solomon.
2 Chronicles 9

And*p when the queen of Sheba heard of the fame of Solomon, she came to prove Solomon with hard questions at Jerusalem, with a very great company, and camels that bare spices, and gold in abundance, and precious stones: and when she was come to Solomon, she communed with him of all that was in her heart.
And*p Solomon told her all her questions: and there was nothing hid from Solomon which he told her not.
And*p when the queen of Sheba had seen the wisdom of Solomon, and the house that he had built,

And*p the meat of his table, and the sitting of his servants, and the attendance of his ministers, and their apparel; his cupbearers also, and their apparel; and his ascent by which he went up into the house of the Lord;*s there was no more spirit in her.
And*p she said to the king, It was a true report which I heard in mine own land of thine acts, and of thy wisdom:
Howbeit*p I believed not their words, until I came, and mine eyes had seen it: and, behold, the one half of the greatness of thy wisdom was not told me: for thou exceedest the fame that I heard.
Happy*p are thy men, and happy are these thy servants, which stand continually before thee, and hear thy wisdom.

Blessed*p be the Lord*s thy God, which delighted in thee to set thee on his throne, to be king for the Lord*s thy God: because thy God loved Israel, to establish them for ever, therefore made he thee king over them, to do judgment and justice.
And*p she gave the king an hundred and twenty talents of gold, and of spices great abundance, and precious stones: neither was there any such spice as the queen of Sheba gave king Solomon.
And*p the servants also of Huram, and the servants of Solomon, which brought gold from Ophir, brought algum trees and precious stones.
And*p the king made of the algum trees terraces to the house of the Lord,*s and to the king's palace, and harps and psalteries for singers: and there were none such seen before in the land of Judah.

And*p king Solomon gave to the queen of Sheba all her desire, whatsoever she asked, beside that which she had brought unto the king. So she turned, and went away to her own land, she and her servants.
Now*p the weight of gold that came to Solomon in one year was six hundred and threescore and six talents of gold;
Beside*p that which chapmen and merchants brought. And all the kings of Arabia and governors of the country brought gold and silver to Solomon.
And*p king Solomon made two hundred targets of beaten gold: six hundred shekels of beaten gold went to one target.
And*p three hundred shields made he of beaten gold: three hundred shekels of gold went to one shield. And the king put them in the house of the forest of Lebanon.
Moreover*p the king made a great throne of ivory, and overlaid it with pure gold.
And*p there were six steps to the throne, with a footstool of gold, which were fastened to the throne, and stays on each side of the sitting place, and two lions standing by the stays:
And*p twelve lions stood there on the one side and on the other upon the six steps. There was not the like made in any kingdom.

And*p all the drinking vessels of king Solomon were of gold, and all the vessels of the house of the forest of Lebanon were of pure gold: none were of silver; it was not any thing accounted of in the days of Solomon.
For*p the king's ships went to Tarshish with the servants of Huram: every three years once came the ships of Tarshish bringing gold, and silver, ivory, and apes, and peacocks.
And*p king Solomon passed all the kings of the earth in riches and wisdom.
And*p all the kings of the earth sought the presence of Solomon, to hear his wisdom, that God had put in his heart.
And*p they brought every man his present, vessels of silver, and vessels of gold, and raiment, harness, and spices, horses, and mules, a rate year by year.
And*p Solomon had four thousand stalls for horses and chariots, and twelve thousand horsemen; whom he bestowed in the chariot cities, and with the king at Jerusalem.
And*p he reigned over all the kings from the river even unto the land of the Philistines, and to the border of Egypt.
And*p the king made silver in Jerusalem as stones, and cedar trees made he as the sycomore trees that are in the low plains in abundance.
And*p they brought unto Solomon horses out of Egypt, and out of all lands.

Now*p the rest of the acts of Solomon, first and last, are they not written in the book of Nathan the prophet, and in the prophecy of Ahijah the Shilonite, and in the visions of Iddo the seer against Jeroboam the son of Nebat?
And*p Solomon reigned in Jerusalem over all Israel forty years.
And*p Solomon slept with his fathers, and he was buried in the city of David his father: and Rehoboam his son reigned in his stead.
2 Chronicles 10
And*p Rehoboam went to Shechem: for to Shechem were all Israel come to make him king.
And*p it came to pass, when Jeroboam the son of Nebat, who was in Egypt, whither he had fled from the presence of Solomon the king, heard it, that Jeroboam returned out of Egypt.
And*p they sent and called him. So Jeroboam and all Israel came and spake to Rehoboam, saying,
Thy*p father made our yoke grievous: now therefore ease thou somewhat the grievous servitude of thy father, and his heavy yoke that he put upon us, and we will serve thee.
And*p he said unto them, Come again unto me after three days. And the people departed.
And*p king Rehoboam took counsel with the old men that had stood before Solomon his father while he yet lived, saying, What counsel give ye me to return answer to this people?
And*p they spake unto him, saying, If thou be kind to this people, and please them, and speak good words to them, they will be thy servants for ever.
But*p he forsook the counsel which the old men gave him, and took counsel with the young men that were brought up with him, that stood before him.
And*p he said unto them, What advice give ye that we may return answer to this people, which have spoken to me, saying, Ease somewhat the yoke that thy father did put upon us?

And*p the young men that were brought up with him spake unto him, saying, Thus shalt thou answer the people that spake unto thee, saying, Thy father made our yoke heavy, but make thou it somewhat lighter for us; thus shalt thou say unto them, My little finger shall be thicker than my father's loins.
For*p whereas my father put a heavy yoke upon you, I will put more to your yoke: my father chastised you with whips, but I will chastise you with scorpions.
So*p Jeroboam and all the people came to Rehoboam on the third day, as the king bade, saying, Come again to me on the third day.
And*p the king answered them roughly; and king Rehoboam forsook the counsel of the old men,
And*p answered them after the advice of the young men, saying, My father made your yoke heavy, but I will add thereto: my father chastised you with whips, but I will chastise you with scorpions.
So*p the king hearkened not unto the people: for the cause was of God, that the Lord*s might perform his word, which he spake by the hand of Ahijah the Shilonite to Jeroboam the son of Nebat.

And*p when all Israel saw that the king would not hearken unto them, the people answered the king, saying, What portion have we in David? and we have none inheritance in the son of Jesse: every man to your tents, O Israel: and now, David, see to thine own house. So all Israel went to their tents.
But*p as for the children of Israel that dwelt in the cities of Judah, Rehoboam reigned over them.

Then*p king Rehoboam sent Hadoram that was over the tribute; and the children of Israel stoned him with stones, that he died. But king Rehoboam made speed to get him up to his chariot, to flee to Jerusalem.
And*p Israel rebelled against the house of David unto this day.
2 Chronicles 11

And*p when Rehoboam was come to Jerusalem, he gathered of the house of Judah and Benjamin an hundred and fourscore thousand chosen men, which were warriors, to fight against Israel, that he might bring the kingdom again to Rehoboam.
But*p the word of the Lord*s came to Shemaiah the man of God, saying,
Speak*p unto Rehoboam the son of Solomon, king of Judah, and to all Israel in Judah and Benjamin, saying,

Thus*p saith the Lord,*s Ye shall not go up, nor fight against your brethren: return every man to his house: for this thing is done of me. And they obeyed the words of the Lord,*s and returned from going against Jeroboam.
And*p Rehoboam dwelt in Jerusalem, and built cities for defence in Judah.
He*p built even Bethâ€“lehem, and Etam, and Tekoa,
And*p Bethâ€“zur, and Soco, and Adullam,
And*p Gath, and Mareshah, and Ziph,
And*p Adoraim, and Lachish, and Azekah,
And*p Zorah, and Aijalon, and Hebron, which are in Judah and in Benjamin fenced cities.
And*p he fortified the strong holds, and put captains in them, and store of victual, and of oil and wine.
And*p in every several city he put shields and spears, and made them exceeding strong, having Judah and Benjamin on his side.
And*p the priests and the Levites that were in all Israel resorted to him out of all their coasts.
For*p the Levites left their suburbs and their possession, and came to Judah and Jerusalem: for Jeroboam and his sons had cast them off from executing the priest's office unto the Lord:*s
And*p he ordained him priests for the high places, and for the devils, and for the calves which he had made.
And*p after them out of all the tribes of Israel such as set their hearts to seek the Lord*s God of Israel came to Jerusalem, to sacrifice unto the Lord*s God of their fathers.
So*p they strengthened the kingdom of Judah, and made Rehoboam the son of Solomon strong, three years: for three years they walked in the way of David and Solomon.
And*p Rehoboam took him Mahalath the daughter of Jerimoth the son of David to wife, and Abihail the daughter of Eliab the son of Jesse;
Which*p bare him children; Jeush, and Shemariah, and Zaham.
And*p after her he took Maachah the daughter of Absalom; which bare him Abijah, and Attai, and Ziza, and Shelomith.

And*p Rehoboam loved Maachah the daughter of Absalom above all his wives and his concubines: (for he took eighteen wives, and threescore concubines; and begat twenty and eight sons, and threescore daughters.)
And*p Rehoboam made Abijah the son of Maachah the chief, to be ruler among his brethren: for he thought to make him king.
And*p he dealt wisely, and dispersed of all his children throughout all the countries of Judah and Benjamin, unto every fenced city: and he gave them victual in abundance. And he desired many wives.
2 Chronicles 12
And*p it came to pass, when Rehoboam had established the kingdom, and had strengthened himself, he forsook the law of the Lord,*s and all Israel with him.
And*p it came to pass, that in the fifth year of king Rehoboam Shishak king of Egypt came up against Jerusalem, because they had transgressed against the Lord,*s
With*p twelve hundred chariots, and threescore thousand horsemen: and the people were without number that came with him out of Egypt; the Libyans, the Sukkiims, and the Ethiopians.
And*p he took the fenced cities which pertained to Judah, and came to Jerusalem.

Then*p came Shemaiah the prophet to Rehoboam, and to the princes of Judah, that were gathered together to Jerusalem because of Shishak, and said unto them, Thus saith the Lord,*s Ye have forsaken me, and therefore have I also left you in the hand of Shishak.
Whereupon*p the princes of Israel and the king humbled themselves; and they said, The Lord*s is righteous.

And*p when the Lord*s saw that they humbled themselves, the word of the Lord*s came to Shemaiah, saying, They have humbled themselves; therefore I will not destroy them, but I will grant them some deliverance; and my wrath shall not be poured out upon Jerusalem by the hand of Shishak.
Nevertheless*p they shall be his servants; that they may know my service, and the service of the kingdoms of the countries.

So*p Shishak king of Egypt came up against Jerusalem, and took away the treasures of the house of the Lord,*s and the treasures of the king's house; he took all: he carried away also the shields of gold which Solomon had made.
Instead*p of which king Rehoboam made shields of brass, and committed them to the hands of the chief of the guard, that kept the entrance of the king's house.
And*p when the king entered into the house of the Lord,*s the guard came and fetched them, and brought them again into the guard chamber.
And*p when he humbled himself, the wrath of the Lord*s turned from him, that he would not destroy him altogether: and also in Judah things went well.

So*p king Rehoboam strengthened himself in Jerusalem, and reigned: for Rehoboam was one and forty years old when he began to reign, and he reigned seventeen years in Jerusalem, the city which the Lord*s had chosen out of all the tribes of Israel, to put his name there. And his mother's name was Naamah an Ammonitess.
And*p he did evil, because he prepared not his heart to seek the Lord.*s

Now*p the acts of Rehoboam, first and last, are they not written in the book of Shemaiah the prophet, and of Iddo the seer concerning genealogies? And there were wars between Rehoboam and Jeroboam continually.
And*p Rehoboam slept with his fathers, and was buried in the city of David: and Abijah his son reigned in his stead.
2 Chronicles 13
Now*p in the eighteenth year of king Jeroboam began Abijah to reign over Judah.
He*p reigned three years in Jerusalem. His mother's name also was Michaiah the daughter of Uriel of Gibeah. And there was war between Abijah and Jeroboam.

And*p Abijah set the battle in array with an army of valiant men of war, even four hundred thousand chosen men: Jeroboam also set the battle in array against him with eight hundred thousand chosen men, being mighty men of valour.
And*p Abijah stood up upon mount Zemaraim, which is in mount Ephraim, and said, Hear me, thou Jeroboam, and all Israel;
Ought*p ye not to know that the Lord*s God of Israel gave the kingdom over Israel to David for ever, even to him and to his sons by a covenant of salt?
Yet*p Jeroboam the son of Nebat, the servant of Solomon the son of David, is risen up, and hath rebelled against his lord.

And*p there are gathered unto him vain men, the children of Belial, and have strengthened themselves against Rehoboam the son of Solomon, when Rehoboam was young and tenderhearted, and could not withstand them.
And*p now ye think to withstand the kingdom of the Lord*s in the hand of the sons of David; and ye be a great multitude, and there are with you golden calves, which Jeroboam made you for gods.

Have*p ye not cast out the priests of the Lord,*s the sons of Aaron, and the Levites, and have made you priests after the manner of the nations of other lands? so that whosoever cometh to consecrate himself with a young bullock and seven rams, the same may be a priest of them that are no gods.
But*p as for us, the Lord*s is our God, and we have not forsaken him; and the priests, which minister unto the Lord,*s are the sons of Aaron, and the Levites wait upon their business:

And*p they burn unto the Lord*s every morning and every evening burnt sacrifices and sweet incense: the shewbread also set they in order upon the pure table; and the candlestick of gold with the lamps thereof, to burn every evening: for we keep the charge of the Lord*s our God; but ye have forsaken him.

And,*p behold, God himself is with us for our captain, and his priests with sounding trumpets to cry alarm against you. O children of Israel, fight ye not against the Lord*s God of your fathers; for ye shall not prosper.
But*p Jeroboam caused an ambushment to come about behind them: so they were before Judah, and the ambushment was behind them.
And*p when Judah looked back, behold, the battle was before and behind: and they cried unto the Lord,*s and the priests sounded with the trumpets.
Then*p the men of Judah gave a shout: and as the men of Judah shouted, it came to pass, that God smote Jeroboam and all Israel before Abijah and Judah.
And*p the children of Israel fled before Judah: and God delivered them into their hand.
And*p Abijah and his people slew them with a great slaughter: so there fell down slain of Israel five hundred thousand chosen men.
Thus*p the children of Israel were brought under at that time, and the children of Judah prevailed, because they relied upon the Lord*s God of their fathers.
And*p Abijah pursued after Jeroboam, and took cities from him, Bethâ€“el with the towns thereof, and Jeshanah with the towns thereof, and Ephrain with the towns thereof.
Neither*p did Jeroboam recover strength again in the days of Abijah: and the Lord*s struck him, and he died.
But*p Abijah waxed mighty, and married fourteen wives, and begat twenty and two sons, and sixteen daughters.
And*p the rest of the acts of Abijah, and his ways, and his sayings, are written in the story of the prophet Iddo.
2 Chronicles 14
So*p Abijah slept with his fathers, and they buried him in the city of David: and Asa his son reigned in his stead. In his days the land was quiet ten years.
And*p Asa did that which was good and right in the eyes of the Lord*s his God:
For*p he took away the altars of the strange gods, and the high places, and brake down the images, and cut down the groves:
And*p commanded Judah to seek the Lord*s God of their fathers, and to do the law and the commandment.
Also*p he took away out of all the cities of Judah the high places and the images: and the kingdom was quiet before him.
And*p he built fenced cities in Judah: for the land had rest, and he had no war in those years; because the Lord*s had given him rest.

Therefore*p he said unto Judah, Let us build these cities, and make about them walls, and towers, gates, and bars, while the land is yet before us; because we have sought the Lord*s our God, we have sought him, and he hath given us rest on every side. So they built and prospered.

And*p Asa had an army of men that bare targets and spears, out of Judah three hundred thousand; and out of Benjamin, that bare shields and drew bows, two hundred and fourscore thousand: all these were mighty men of valour.
And*p there came out against them Zerah the Ethiopian with an host of a thousand thousand, and three hundred chariots; and came unto Mareshah.
Then*p Asa went out against him, and they set the battle in array in the valley of Zephathah at Mareshah.

And*p Asa cried unto the Lord*s his God, and said, Lord,*s it is nothing with thee to help, whether with many, or with them that have no power: help us, O Lord*s our God; for we rest on thee, and in thy name we go against this multitude. O Lord,*s thou art our God; let not man prevail against thee.
So*p the Lord*s smote the Ethiopians before Asa, and before Judah; and the Ethiopians fled.

And*p Asa and the people that were with him pursued them unto Gerar: and the Ethiopians were overthrown, that they could not recover themselves; for they were destroyed before the Lord,*s and before his host; and they carried away very much spoil.
And*p they smote all the cities round about Gerar; for the fear of the Lord*s came upon them: and they spoiled all the cities; for there was exceeding much spoil in them.
They*p smote also the tents of cattle, and carried away sheep and camels in abundance, and returned to Jerusalem.
2 Chronicles 15
And*p the Spirit of God came upon Azariah the son of Oded:

And*p he went out to meet Asa, and said unto him, Hear ye me, Asa, and all Judah and Benjamin; The Lord*s is with you, while ye be with him; and if ye seek him, he will be found of you; but if ye forsake him, he will forsake you.
Now*p for a long season Israel hath been without the true God, and without a teaching priest, and without law.
But*p when they in their trouble did turn unto the Lord*s God of Israel, and sought him, he was found of them.
And*p in those times there was no peace to him that went out, nor to him that came in, but great vexations were upon all the inhabitants of the countries.
And*p nation was destroyed of nation, and city of city: for God did vex them with all adversity.
Be*p ye strong therefore, and let not your hands be weak: for your work shall be rewarded.

And*p when Asa heard these words, and the prophecy of Oded the prophet, he took courage, and put away the abominable idols out of all the land of Judah and Benjamin, and out of the cities which he had taken from mount Ephraim, and renewed the altar of the Lord,*s that was before the porch of the Lord.*s

And*p he gathered all Judah and Benjamin, and the strangers with them out of Ephraim and Manasseh, and out of Simeon: for they fell to him out of Israel in abundance, when they saw that the Lord*s his God was with him.
So*p they gathered themselves together at Jerusalem in the third month, in the fifteenth year of the reign of Asa.
And*p they offered unto the Lord*s the same time, of the spoil which they had brought, seven hundred oxen and seven thousand sheep.
And*p they entered into a covenant to seek the Lord*s God of their fathers with all their heart and with all their soul;
That*p whosoever would not seek the Lord*s God of Israel should be put to death, whether small or great, whether man or woman.
And*p they sware unto the Lord*s with a loud voice, and with shouting, and with trumpets, and with cornets.
And*p all Judah rejoiced at the oath: for they had sworn with all their heart, and sought him with their whole desire; and he was found of them: and the Lord*s gave them rest round about.

And*p also concerning Maachah the mother of Asa the king, he removed her from being queen, because she had made an idol in a grove: and Asa cut down her idol, and stamped it, and burnt it at the brook Kidron.
But*p the high places were not taken away out of Israel: nevertheless the heart of Asa was perfect all his days.
And*p he brought into the house of God the things that his father had dedicated, and that he himself had dedicated, silver, and gold, and vessels.
And*p there was no more war unto the five and thirtieth year of the reign of Asa.
2 Chronicles 16
In*p the six and thirtieth year of the reign of Asa Baasha king of Israel came up against Judah, and built Ramah, to the intent that he might let none go out or come in to Asa king of Judah.
Then*p Asa brought out silver and gold out of the treasures of the house of the Lord*s and of the king's house, and sent to Benâ€“hadad king of Syria, that dwelt at Damascus, saying,

There*p is a league between me and thee, as there was between my father and thy father: behold, I have sent thee silver and gold; go, break thy league with Baasha king of Israel, that he may depart from me.
And*p Benâ€“hadad hearkened unto king Asa, and sent the captains of his armies against the cities of Israel; and they smote Ijon, and Dan, and Abelâ€“maim, and all the store cities of Naphtali.
And*p it came to pass, when Baasha heard it, that he left off building of Ramah, and let his work cease.
Then*p Asa the king took all Judah; and they carried away the stones of Ramah, and the timber thereof, wherewith Baasha was building; and he built therewith Geba and Mizpah.

And*p at that time Hanani the seer came to Asa king of Judah, and said unto him, Because thou hast relied on the king of Syria, and not relied on the Lord*s thy God, therefore is the host of the king of Syria escaped out of thine hand.
Were*p not the Ethiopians and the Libyans a huge host, with very many chariots and horsemen? yet, because thou didst rely on the Lord,*s he delivered them into thine hand.

For*p the eyes of the Lord*s run to and fro throughout the whole earth, to shew himself strong in the behalf of them whose heart is perfect toward him. Herein thou hast done foolishly: therefore from henceforth thou shalt have wars.
Then*p Asa was wroth with the seer, and put him in a prison house; for he was in a rage with him because of this thing. And Asa oppressed some of the people the same time.
And,*p behold, the acts of Asa, first and last, lo, they are written in the book of the kings of Judah and Israel.
And*p Asa in the thirty and ninth year of his reign was diseased in his feet, until his disease was exceeding great: yet in his disease he sought not to the Lord,*s but to the physicians.
And*p Asa slept with his fathers, and died in the one and fortieth year of his reign.

And*p they buried him in his own sepulchres, which he had made for himself in the city of David, and laid him in the bed which was filled with sweet odours and divers kinds of spices prepared by the apothecaries' art: and they made a very great burning for him.
2 Chronicles 17
And*p Jehoshaphat his son reigned in his stead, and strengthened himself against Israel.
And*p he placed forces in all the fenced cities of Judah, and set garrisons in the land of Judah, and in the cities of Ephraim, which Asa his father had taken.
And*p the Lord*s was with Jehoshaphat, because he walked in the first ways of his father David, and sought not unto Baalim;
But*p sought to the Lord*s God of his father, and walked in his commandments, and not after the doings of Israel.
Therefore*p the Lord*s stablished the kingdom in his hand; and all Judah brought to Jehoshaphat presents; and he had riches and honour in abundance.
And*p his heart was lifted up in the ways of the Lord:*s moreover he took away the high places and groves out of Judah.
Also*p in the third year of his reign he sent to his princes, even to Benâ€“hail, and to Obadiah, and to Zechariah, and to Nethaneel, and to Michaiah, to teach in the cities of Judah.

And*p with them he sent Levites, even Shemaiah, and Nethaniah, and Zebadiah, and Asahel, and Shemiramoth, and Jonathan, and Adonijah, and Tobijah, and Tobâ€“adonijah, Levites; and with them Elishama and Jehoram, priests.
And*p they taught in Judah, and had the book of the law of the Lord*s with them, and went about throughout all the cities of Judah, and taught the people.
And*p the fear of the Lord*s fell upon all the kingdoms of the lands that were round about Judah, so that they made no war against Jehoshaphat.

Also*p some of the Philistines brought Jehoshaphat presents, and tribute silver; and the Arabians brought him flocks, seven thousand and seven hundred rams, and seven thousand and seven hundred he goats.
And*p Jehoshaphat waxed great exceedingly; and he built in Judah castles, and cities of store.
And*p he had much business in the cities of Judah: and the men of war, mighty men of valour, were in Jerusalem.
And*p these are the numbers of them according to the house of their fathers: Of Judah, the captains of thousands; Adnah the chief, and with him mighty men of valour three hundred thousand.
And*p next to him was Jehohanan the captain, and with him two hundred and fourscore thousand.
And*p next him was Amasiah the son of Zichri, who willingly offered himself unto the Lord;*s and with him two hundred thousand mighty men of valour.
And*p of Benjamin; Eliada a mighty man of valour, and with him armed men with bow and shield two hundred thousand.
And*p next him was Jehozabad, and with him an hundred and fourscore thousand ready prepared for the war.
These*p waited on the king, beside those whom the king put in the fenced cities throughout all Judah.
2 Chronicles 18
Now*p Jehoshaphat had riches and honour in abundance, and joined affinity with Ahab.

And*p after certain years he went down to Ahab to Samaria. And Ahab killed sheep and oxen for him in abundance, and for the people that he had with him, and persuaded him to go up with him to Ramothâ€“gilead.

And*p Ahab king of Israel said unto Jehoshaphat king of Judah, Wilt thou go with me to Ramothâ€“gilead? And he answered him, I am as thou art, and my people as thy people; and we will be with thee in the war.
And*p Jehoshaphat said unto the king of Israel, Enquire, I pray thee, at the word of the Lord*s to day.

Therefore*p the king of Israel gathered together of prophets four hundred men, and said unto them, Shall we go to Ramothâ€“gilead to battle, or shall I forbear? And they said, Go up; for God will deliver it into the king's hand.
But*p Jehoshaphat said, Is there not here a prophet of the Lord*s besides, that we might enquire of him?

And*p the king of Israel said unto Jehoshaphat, There is yet one man, by whom we may enquire of the Lord:*s but I hate him; for he never prophesied good unto me, but always evil: the same is Micaiah the son of Imlah. And Jehoshaphat said, Let not the king say so.
And*p the king of Israel called for one of his officers, and said, Fetch quickly Micaiah the son of Imlah.

And*p the king of Israel and Jehoshaphat king of Judah sat either of them on his throne, clothed in their robes, and they sat in a void place at the entering in of the gate of Samaria; and all the prophets prophesied before them.
And*p Zedekiah the son of Chenaanah had made him horns of iron, and said, Thus saith the Lord,*s With these thou shalt push Syria until they be consumed.
And*p all the prophets prophesied so, saying, Go up to Ramothâ€“gilead, and prosper: for the Lord*s shall deliver it into the hand of the king.

And*p the messenger that went to call Micaiah spake to him, saying, Behold, the words of the prophets declare good to the king with one assent; let thy word therefore, I pray thee, be like one of theirs, and speak thou good.
And*p Micaiah said, As the Lord*s liveth, even what my God saith, that will I speak.

And*p when he was come to the king, the king said unto him, Micaiah, shall we go to Ramothâ€“gilead to battle, or shall I forbear? And he said, Go ye up, and prosper, and they shall be delivered into your hand.
And*p the king said to him, How many times shall I adjure thee that thou say nothing but the truth to me in the name of the Lord?*s

Then*p he said, I did see all Israel scattered upon the mountains, as sheep that have no shepherd: and the Lord*s said, These have no master; let them return therefore every man to his house in peace.
And*p the king of Israel said to Jehoshaphat, Did I not tell thee that he would not prophesy good unto me, but evil?
Again*p he said, Therefore hear the word of the Lord;*s I saw the Lord*s sitting upon his throne, and all the host of heaven standing on his right hand and on his left.
And*p the Lord*s said, Who shall entice Ahab king of Israel, that he may go up and fall at Ramothâ€“gilead? And one spake saying after this manner, and another saying after that manner.
Then*p there came out a spirit, and stood before the Lord,*s and said, I will entice him. And the Lord*s said unto him, Wherewith?
And*p he said, I will go out, and be a lying spirit in the mouth of all his prophets. And the Lord*s said, Thou shalt entice him, and thou shalt also prevail: go out, and do even so.
Now*p therefore, behold, the Lord*s hath put a lying spirit in the mouth of these thy prophets, and the Lord*s hath spoken evil against thee.
Then*p Zedekiah the son of Chenaanah came near, and smote Micaiah upon the cheek, and said, Which way went the Spirit of the Lord*s from me to speak unto thee?
And*p Micaiah said, Behold, thou shalt see on that day when thou shalt go into an inner chamber to hide thyself.
Then*p the king of Israel said, Take ye Micaiah, and carry him back to Amon the governor of the city, and to Joash the king's son;
And*p say, Thus saith the king, Put this fellow in the prison, and feed him with bread of affliction and with water of affliction, until I return in peace.
And*p Micaiah said, If thou certainly return in peace, then hath not the Lord*s spoken by me. And he said, Hearken, all ye people.
So*p the king of Israel and Jehoshaphat the king of Judah went up to Ramothâ€“gilead.
And*p the king of Israel said unto Jehoshaphat, I will disguise myself, and will go to the battle; but put thou on thy robes. So the king of Israel disguised himself; and they went to the battle.
Now*p the king of Syria had commanded the captains of the chariots that were with him, saying, Fight ye not with small or great, save only with the king of Israel.

And*p it came to pass, when the captains of the chariots saw Jehoshaphat, that they said, It is the king of Israel. Therefore they compassed about him to fight: but Jehoshaphat cried out, and the Lord*s helped him; and God moved them to depart from him.
For*p it came to pass, that, when the captains of the chariots perceived that it was not the king of Israel, they turned back again from pursuing him.

And*p a certain man drew a bow at a venture, and smote the king of Israel between the joints of the harness: therefore he said to his chariot man, Turn thine hand, that thou mayest carry me out of the host; for I am wounded.
And*p the battle increased that day: howbeit the king of Israel stayed himself up in his chariot against the Syrians until the even: and about the time of the sun going down he died.
2 Chronicles 19
And*p Jehoshaphat the king of Judah returned to his house in peace to Jerusalem.

And*p Jehu the son of Hanani the seer went out to meet him, and said to king Jehoshaphat, Shouldest thou help the ungodly, and love them that hate the Lord?*s therefore is wrath upon thee from before the Lord.*s
Nevertheless*p there are good things found in thee, in that thou hast taken away the groves out of the land, and hast prepared thine heart to seek God.
And*p Jehoshaphat dwelt at Jerusalem: and he went out again through the people from Beerâ€“sheba to mount Ephraim, and brought them back unto the Lord*s God of their fathers.
And*p he set judges in the land throughout all the fenced cities of Judah, city by city,
And*p said to the judges, Take heed what ye do: for ye judge not for man, but for the Lord,*s who is with you in the judgment.
Wherefore*p now let the fear of the Lord*s be upon you; take heed and do it: for there is no iniquity with the Lord*s our God, nor respect of persons, nor taking of gifts.

Moreover*p in Jerusalem did Jehoshaphat set of the Levites, and of the priests, and of the chief of the fathers of Israel, for the judgment of the Lord,*s and for controversies, when they returned to Jerusalem.
And*p he charged them, saying, Thus shall ye do in the fear of the Lord,*s faithfully, and with a perfect heart.

And*p what cause soever shall come to you of your brethren that dwell in their cities, between blood and blood, between law and commandment, statutes and judgments, ye shall even warn them that they trespass not against the Lord,*s and so wrath come upon you, and upon your brethren: this do, and ye shall not trespass.

And,*p behold, Amariah the chief priest is over you in all matters of the Lord;*s and Zebadiah the son of Ishmael, the ruler of the house of Judah, for all the king's matters: also the Levites shall be officers before you. Deal courageously, and the Lord*s shall be with the good.
2 Chronicles 20
It*p came to pass after this also, that the children of Moab, and the children of Ammon, and with them other beside the Ammonites, came against Jehoshaphat to battle.
Then*p there came some that told Jehoshaphat, saying, There cometh a great multitude against thee from beyond the sea on this side Syria; and, behold, they be in Hazazonâ€“tamar, which is Enâ€“gedi.
And*p Jehoshaphat feared, and set himself to seek the Lord,*s and proclaimed a fast throughout all Judah.
And*p Judah gathered themselves together, to ask help of the Lord:*s even out of all the cities of Judah they came to seek the Lord.*s
And*p Jehoshaphat stood in the congregation of Judah and Jerusalem, in the house of the Lord,*s before the new court,

And*p said, O Lord*s God of our fathers, art not thou God in heaven? and rulest not thou over all the kingdoms of the heathen? and in thine hand is there not power and might, so that none is able to withstand thee?
Art*p not thou our God, who didst drive out the inhabitants of this land before thy people Israel, and gavest it to the seed of Abraham thy friend for ever?
And*p they dwelt therein, and have built thee a sanctuary therein for thy name, saying,

If,*p when evil cometh upon us, as the sword, judgment, or pestilence, or famine, we stand before this house, and in thy presence, (for thy name is in this house,) and cry unto thee in our affliction, then thou wilt hear and help.
And*p now, behold, the children of Ammon and Moab and mount Seir, whom thou wouldest not let Israel invade, when they came out of the land of Egypt, but they turned from them, and destroyed them not;
Behold,*p I say, how they reward us, to come to cast us out of thy possession, which thou hast given us to inherit.
O*p our God, wilt thou not judge them? for we have no might against this great company that cometh against us; neither know we what to do: but our eyes are upon thee.
And*p all Judah stood before the Lord,*s with their little ones, their wives, and their children.
Then*p upon Jahaziel the son of Zechariah, the son of Benaiah, the son of Jeiel, the son of Mattaniah, a Levite of the sons of Asaph, came the Spirit of the Lord*s in the midst of the congregation;

And*p he said, Hearken ye, all Judah, and ye inhabitants of Jerusalem, and thou king Jehoshaphat, Thus saith the Lord*s unto you, Be not afraid nor dismayed by reason of this great multitude; for the battle is not yours, but God's.
To*p morrow go ye down against them: behold, they come up by the cliff of Ziz; and ye shall find them at the end of the brook, before the wilderness of Jeruel.

Ye*p shall not need to fight in this battle: set yourselves, stand ye still, and see the salvation of the Lord*s with you, O Judah and Jerusalem: fear not, nor be dismayed; to morrow go out against them: for the Lord*s will be with you.
And*p Jehoshaphat bowed his head with his face to the ground: and all Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem fell before the Lord,*s worshipping the Lord.*s
And*p the Levites, of the children of the Kohathites, and of the children of the Korhites, stood up to praise the Lord*s God of Israel with a loud voice on high.

And*p they rose early in the morning, and went forth into the wilderness of Tekoa: and as they went forth, Jehoshaphat stood and said, Hear me, O Judah, and ye inhabitants of Jerusalem; Believe in the Lord*s your God, so shall ye be established; believe his prophets, so shall ye prosper.

And*p when he had consulted with the people, he appointed singers unto the Lord,*s and that should praise the beauty of holiness, as they went out before the army, and to say, Praise the Lord;*s for his mercy endureth for ever.
And*p when they began to sing and to praise, the Lord*s set ambushments against the children of Ammon, Moab, and mount Seir, which were come against Judah; and they were smitten.

For*p the children of Ammon and Moab stood up against the inhabitants of mount Seir, utterly to slay and destroy them: and when they had made an end of the inhabitants of Seir, every one helped to destroy another.
And*p when Judah came toward the watch tower in the wilderness, they looked unto the multitude, and, behold, they were dead bodies fallen to the earth, and none escaped.

And*p when Jehoshaphat and his people came to take away the spoil of them, they found among them in abundance both riches with the dead bodies, and precious jewels, which they stripped off for themselves, more than they could carry away: and they were three days in gathering of the spoil, it was so much.
And*p on the fourth day they assembled themselves in the valley of Berachah; for there they blessed the Lord:*s therefore the name of the same place was called, The valley of Berachah, unto this day.
Then*p they returned, every man of Judah and Jerusalem, and Jehoshaphat in the forefront of them, to go again to Jerusalem with joy; for the Lord*s had made them to rejoice over their enemies.
And*p they came to Jerusalem with psalteries and harps and trumpets unto the house of the Lord.*s
And*p the fear of God was on all the kingdoms of those countries, when they had heard that the Lord*s fought against the enemies of Israel.
So*p the realm of Jehoshaphat was quiet: for his God gave him rest round about.

And*p Jehoshaphat reigned over Judah: he was thirty and five years old when he began to reign, and he reigned twenty and five years in Jerusalem. And his mother's name was Azubah the daughter of Shilhi.
And*p he walked in the way of Asa his father, and departed not from it, doing that which was right in the sight of the Lord.*s
Howbeit*p the high places were not taken away: for as yet the people had not prepared their hearts unto the God of their fathers.
Now*p the rest of the acts of Jehoshaphat, first and last, behold, they are written in the book of Jehu the son of Hanani, who is mentioned in the book of the kings of Israel.
And*p after this did Jehoshaphat king of Judah join himself with Ahaziah king of Israel, who did very wickedly:
And*p he joined himself with him to make ships to go to Tarshish: and they made the ships in Ezionâ€“geber.

Then*p Eliezer the son of Dodavah of Mareshah prophesied against Jehoshaphat, saying, Because thou hast joined thyself with Ahaziah, the Lord*s hath broken thy works. And the ships were broken, that they were not able to go to Tarshish.
2 Chronicles 21
Now*p Jehoshaphat slept with his fathers, and was buried with his fathers in the city of David. And Jehoram his son reigned in his stead.
And*p he had brethren the sons of Jehoshaphat, Azariah, and Jehiel, and Zechariah, and Azariah, and Michael, and Shephatiah: all these were the sons of Jehoshaphat king of Israel.
And*p their father gave them great gifts of silver, and of gold, and of precious things, with fenced cities in Judah: but the kingdom gave he to Jehoram; because he was the firstborn.
Now*p when Jehoram was risen up to the kingdom of his father, he strengthened himself, and slew all his brethren with the sword, and divers also of the princes of Israel.
Jehoram*p was thirty and two years old when he began to reign, and he reigned eight years in Jerusalem.
And*p he walked in the way of the kings of Israel, like as did the house of Ahab: for he had the daughter of Ahab to wife: and he wrought that which was evil in the eyes of the Lord.*s
Howbeit*p the Lord*s would not destroy the house of David, because of the covenant that he had made with David, and as he promised to give a light to him and to his sons for ever.
In*p his days the Edomites revolted from under the dominion of Judah, and made themselves a king.
Then*p Jehoram went forth with his princes, and all his chariots with him: and he rose up by night, and smote the Edomites which compassed him in, and the captains of the chariots.
So*p the Edomites revolted from under the hand of Judah unto this day. The same time also did Libnah revolt from under his hand; because he had forsaken the Lord*s God of his fathers.
Moreover*p he made high places in the mountains of Judah, and caused the inhabitants of Jerusalem to commit fornication, and compelled Judah thereto.

And*p there came a writing to him from Elijah the prophet, saying, Thus saith the Lord*s God of David thy father, Because thou hast not walked in the ways of Jehoshaphat thy father, nor in the ways of Asa king of Judah,

But*p hast walked in the way of the kings of Israel, and hast made Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem to go a whoring, like to the whoredoms of the house of Ahab, and also hast slain thy brethren of thy father's house, which were better than thyself:
Behold,*p with a great plague will the Lord*s smite thy people, and thy children, and thy wives, and all thy goods:
And*p thou shalt have great sickness by disease of thy bowels, until thy bowels fall out by reason of the sickness day by day.
Moreover*p the Lord*s stirred up against Jehoram the spirit of the Philistines, and of the Arabians, that were near the Ethiopians:

And*p they came up into Judah, and brake into it, and carried away all the substance that was found in the king's house, and his sons also, and his wives; so that there was never a son left him, save Jehoahaz, the youngest of his sons.
And*p after all this the Lord*s smote him in his bowels with an incurable disease.

And*p it came to pass, that in process of time, after the end of two years, his bowels fell out by reason of his sickness: so he died of sore diseases. And his people made no burning for him, like the burning of his fathers.

Thirty*p and two years old was he when he began to reign, and he reigned in Jerusalem eight years, and departed without being desired. Howbeit they buried him in the city of David, but not in the sepulchres of the kings.
2 Chronicles 22

And*p the inhabitants of Jerusalem made Ahaziah his youngest son king in his stead: for the band of men that came with the Arabians to the camp had slain all the eldest. So Ahaziah the son of Jehoram king of Judah reigned.
Forty*p and two years old was Ahaziah when he began to reign, and he reigned one year in Jerusalem. His mother's name also was Athaliah the daughter of Omri.
He*p also walked in the ways of the house of Ahab: for his mother was his counsellor to do wickedly.
Wherefore*p he did evil in the sight of the Lord*s like the house of Ahab: for they were his counsellors after the death of his father to his destruction.
He*p walked also after their counsel, and went with Jehoram the son of Ahab king of Israel to war against Hazael king of Syria at Ramothâ€“gilead: and the Syrians smote Joram.

And*p he returned to be healed in Jezreel because of the wounds which were given him at Ramah, when he fought with Hazael king of Syria. And Azariah the son of Jehoram king of Judah went down to see Jehoram the son of Ahab at Jezreel, because he was sick.

And*p the destruction of Ahaziah was of God by coming to Joram: for when he was come, he went out with Jehoram against Jehu the son of Nimshi, whom the Lord*s had anointed to cut off the house of Ahab.

And*p it came to pass, that, when Jehu was executing judgment upon the house of Ahab, and found the princes of Judah, and the sons of the brethren of Ahaziah, that ministered to Ahaziah, he slew them.

And*p he sought Ahaziah: and they caught him, (for he was hid in Samaria,) and brought him to Jehu: and when they had slain him, they buried him: Because, said they, he is the son of Jehoshaphat, who sought the Lord*s with all his heart. So the house of Ahaziah had no power to keep still the kingdom.
But*p when Athaliah the mother of Ahaziah saw that her son was dead, she arose and destroyed all the seed royal of the house of Judah.

But*p Jehoshabeath, the daughter of the king, took Joash the son of Ahaziah, and stole him from among the king's sons that were slain, and put him and his nurse in a bedchamber. So Jehoshabeath, the daughter of king Jehoram, the wife of Jehoiada the priest, (for she was the sister of Ahaziah,) hid him from Athaliah, so that she slew him not.
And*p he was with them hid in the house of God six years: and Athaliah reigned over the land.
2 Chronicles 23

And*p in the seventh year Jehoiada strengthened himself, and took the captains of hundreds, Azariah the son of Jeroham, and Ishmael the son of Jehohanan, and Azariah the son of Obed, and Maaseiah the son of Adaiah, and Elishaphat the son of Zichri, into covenant with him.
And*p they went about in Judah, and gathered the Levites out of all the cities of Judah, and the chief of the fathers of Israel, and they came to Jerusalem.
And*p all the congregation made a covenant with the king in the house of God. And he said unto them, Behold, the king's son shall reign, as the Lord*s hath said of the sons of David.
This*p is the thing that ye shall do; A third part of you entering on the sabbath, of the priests and of the Levites, shall be porters of the doors;
And*p a third part shall be at the king's house; and a third part at the gate of the foundation: and all the people shall be in the courts of the house of the Lord.*s
But*p let none come into the house of the Lord,*s save the priests, and they that minister of the Levites; they shall go in, for they are holy: but all the people shall keep the watch of the Lord.*s

And*p the Levites shall compass the king round about, every man with his weapons in his hand; and whosoever else cometh into the house, he shall be put to death: but be ye with the king when he cometh in, and when he goeth out.

So*p the Levites and all Judah did according to all things that Jehoiada the priest had commanded, and took every man his men that were to come in on the sabbath, with them that were to go out on the sabbath: for Jehoiada the priest dismissed not the courses.
Moreover*p Jehoiada the priest delivered to the captains of hundreds spears, and bucklers, and shields, that had been king David's, which were in the house of God.
And*p he set all the people, every man having his weapon in his hand, from the right side of the temple to the left side of the temple, along by the altar and the temple, by the king round about.
Then*p they brought out the king's son, and put upon him the crown, and gave him the testimony, and made him king. And Jehoiada and his sons anointed him, and said, God save the king.
Now*p when Athaliah heard the noise of the people running and praising the king, she came to the people into the house of the Lord:*s

And*p she looked, and, behold, the king stood at his pillar at the entering in, and the princes and the trumpets by the king: and all the people of the land rejoiced, and sounded with trumpets, also the singers with instruments of musick, and such as taught to sing praise. Then Athaliah rent her clothes, and said, Treason, Treason.

Then*p Jehoiada the priest brought out the captains of hundreds that were set over the host, and said unto them, Have her forth of the ranges: and whoso followeth her, let him be slain with the sword. For the priest said, Slay her not in the house of the Lord.*s
So*p they laid hands on her; and when she was come to the entering of the horse gate by the king's house, they slew her there.
And*p Jehoiada made a covenant between him, and between all the people, and between the king, that they should be the Lord's*s people.
Then*p all the people went to the house of Baal, and brake it down, and brake his altars and his images in pieces, and slew Mattan the priest of Baal before the altars.
