Also*p Jehoiada appointed the offices of the house of the Lord*s by the hand of the priests the Levites, whom David had distributed in the house of the Lord,*s to offer the burnt offerings of the Lord,*s as it is written in the law of Moses, with rejoicing and with singing, as it was ordained by David.
And*p he set the porters at the gates of the house of the Lord,*s that none which was unclean in any thing should enter in.

And*p he took the captains of hundreds, and the nobles, and the governors of the people, and all the people of the land, and brought down the king from the house of the Lord:*s and they came through the high gate into the king's house, and set the king upon the throne of the kingdom.
And*p all the people of the land rejoiced: and the city was quiet, after that they had slain Athaliah with the sword.
2 Chronicles 24
Joash*p was seven years old when he began to reign, and he reigned forty years in Jerusalem. His mother's name also was Zibiah of Beerâ€“sheba.
And*p Joash did that which was right in the sight of the Lord*s all the days of Jehoiada the priest.
And*p Jehoiada took for him two wives; and he begat sons and daughters.
And*p it came to pass after this, that Joash was minded to repair the house of the Lord.*s

And*p he gathered together the priests and the Levites, and said to them, Go out unto the cities of Judah, and gather of all Israel money to repair the house of your God from year to year, and see that ye hasten the matter. Howbeit the Levites hastened it not.

And*p the king called for Jehoiada the chief, and said unto him, Why hast thou not required of the Levites to bring in out of Judah and out of Jerusalem the collection, according to the commandment of Moses the servant of the Lord,*s and of the congregation of Israel, for the tabernacle of witness?
For*p the sons of Athaliah, that wicked woman, had broken up the house of God; and also all the dedicated things of the house of the Lord*s did they bestow upon Baalim.
And*p at the king's commandment they made a chest, and set it without at the gate of the house of the Lord.*s
And*p they made a proclamation through Judah and Jerusalem, to bring in to the Lord*s the collection that Moses the servant of God laid upon Israel in the wilderness.
And*p all the princes and all the people rejoiced, and brought in, and cast into the chest, until they had made an end.

Now*p it came to pass, that at what time the chest was brought unto the king's office by the hand of the Levites, and when they saw that there was much money, the king's scribe and the high priest's officer came and emptied the chest, and took it, and carried it to his place again. Thus they did day by day, and gathered money in abundance.

And*p the king and Jehoiada gave it to such as did the work of the service of the house of the Lord,*s and hired masons and carpenters to repair the house of the Lord,*s and also such as wrought iron and brass to mend the house of the Lord.*s
So*p the workmen wrought, and the work was perfected by them, and they set the house of God in his state, and strengthened it.

And*p when they had finished it, they brought the rest of the money before the king and Jehoiada, whereof were made vessels for the house of the Lord,*s even vessels to minister, and to offer withal, and spoons, and vessels of gold and silver. And they offered burnt offerings in the house of the Lord*s continually all the days of Jehoiada.
But*p Jehoiada waxed old, and was full of days when he died; an hundred and thirty years old was he when he died.
And*p they buried him in the city of David among the kings, because he had done good in Israel, both toward God, and toward his house.
Now*p after the death of Jehoiada came the princes of Judah, and made obeisance to the king. Then the king hearkened unto them.
And*p they left the house of the Lord*s God of their fathers, and served groves and idols: and wrath came upon Judah and Jerusalem for this their trespass.
Yet*p he sent prophets to them, to bring them again unto the Lord;*s and they testified against them: but they would not give ear.

And*p the Spirit of God came upon Zechariah the son of Jehoiada the priest, which stood above the people, and said unto them, Thus saith God, Why transgress ye the commandments of the Lord,*s that ye cannot prosper? because ye have forsaken the Lord,*s he hath also forsaken you.
And*p they conspired against him, and stoned him with stones at the commandment of the king in the court of the house of the Lord.*s
Thus*p Joash the king remembered not the kindness which Jehoiada his father had done to him, but slew his son. And when he died, he said, The Lord*s look upon it, and require it.

And*p it came to pass at the end of the year, that the host of Syria came up against him: and they came to Judah and Jerusalem, and destroyed all the princes of the people from among the people, and sent all the spoil of them unto the king of Damascus.

For*p the army of the Syrians came with a small company of men, and the Lord*s delivered a very great host into their hand, because they had forsaken the Lord*s God of their fathers. So they executed judgment against Joash.

And*p when they were departed from him, (for they left him in great diseases,) his own servants conspired against him for the blood of the sons of Jehoiada the priest, and slew him on his bed, and he died: and they buried him in the city of David, but they buried him not in the sepulchres of the kings.
And*p these are they that conspired against him; Zabad the son of Shimeath an Ammonitess, and Jehozabad the son of Shimrith a Moabitess.

Now*p concerning his sons, and the greatness of the burdens laid upon him, and the repairing of the house of God, behold, they are written in the story of the book of the kings. And Amaziah his son reigned in his stead.
2 Chronicles 25
Amaziah*p was twenty and five years old when he began to reign, and he reigned twenty and nine years in Jerusalem. And his mother's name was Jehoaddan of Jerusalem.
And*p he did that which was right in the sight of the Lord,*s but not with a perfect heart.
Now*p it came to pass, when the kingdom was established to him, that he slew his servants that had killed the king his father.

But*p he slew not their children, but did as it is written in the law in the book of Moses, where the Lord*s commanded, saying, The fathers shall not die for the children, neither shall the children die for the fathers, but every man shall die for his own sin.

Moreover*p Amaziah gathered Judah together, and made them captains over thousands, and captains over hundreds, according to the houses of their fathers, throughout all Judah and Benjamin: and he numbered them from twenty years old and above, and found them three hundred thousand choice men, able to go forth to war, that could handle spear and shield.
He*p hired also an hundred thousand mighty men of valour out of Israel for an hundred talents of silver.
But*p there came a man of God to him, saying, O king, let not the army of Israel go with thee; for the Lord*s is not with Israel, to wit, with all the children of Ephraim.
But*p if thou wilt go, do it, be strong for the battle: God shall make thee fall before the enemy: for God hath power to help, and to cast down.

And*p Amaziah said to the man of God, But what shall we do for the hundred talents which I have given to the army of Israel? And the man of God answered, The Lord*s is able to give thee much more than this.
Then*p Amaziah separated them, to wit, the army that was come to him out of Ephraim, to go home again: wherefore their anger was greatly kindled against Judah, and they returned home in great anger.
And*p Amaziah strengthened himself, and led forth his people, and went to the valley of salt, and smote of the children of Seir ten thousand.

And*p other ten thousand left alive did the children of Judah carry away captive, and brought them unto the top of the rock, and cast them down from the top of the rock, that they all were broken in pieces.

But*p the soldiers of the army which Amaziah sent back, that they should not go with him to battle, fell upon the cities of Judah, from Samaria even unto Bethâ€“horon, and smote three thousand of them, and took much spoil.

Now*p it came to pass, after that Amaziah was come from the slaughter of the Edomites, that he brought the gods of the children of Seir, and set them up to be his gods, and bowed down himself before them, and burned incense unto them.

Wherefore*p the anger of the Lord*s was kindled against Amaziah, and he sent unto him a prophet, which said unto him, Why hast thou sought after the gods of the people, which could not deliver their own people out of thine hand?

And*p it came to pass, as he talked with him, that the king said unto him, Art thou made of the king's counsel? forbear; why shouldest thou be smitten? Then the prophet forbare, and said, I know that God hath determined to destroy thee, because thou hast done this, and hast not hearkened unto my counsel.
Then*p Amaziah king of Judah took advice, and sent to Joash, the son of Jehoahaz, the son of Jehu, king of Israel, saying, Come, let us see one another in the face.

And*p Joash king of Israel sent to Amaziah king of Judah, saying, The thistle that was in Lebanon sent to the cedar that was in Lebanon, saying, Give thy daughter to my son to wife: and there passed by a wild beast that was in Lebanon, and trode down the thistle.

Thou*p sayest, Lo, thou hast smitten the Edomites; and thine heart lifteth thee up to boast: abide now at home; why shouldest thou meddle to thine hurt, that thou shouldest fall, even thou, and Judah with thee?
But*p Amaziah would not hear; for it came of God, that he might deliver them into the hand of their enemies, because they sought after the gods of Edom.
So*p Joash the king of Israel went up; and they saw one another in the face, both he and Amaziah king of Judah, at Bethâ€“shemesh, which belongeth to Judah.
And*p Judah was put to the worse before Israel, and they fled every man to his tent.

And*p Joash the king of Israel took Amaziah king of Judah, the son of Joash, the son of Jehoahaz, at Bethâ€“shemesh, and brought him to Jerusalem, and brake down the wall of Jerusalem from the gate of Ephraim to the corner gate, four hundred cubits.
And*p he took all the gold and the silver, and all the vessels that were found in the house of God with Obedâ€“edom, and the treasures of the king's house, the hostages also, and returned to Samaria.
And*p Amaziah the son of Joash king of Judah lived after the death of Joash son of Jehoahaz king of Israel fifteen years.
Now*p the rest of the acts of Amaziah, first and last, behold, are they not written in the book of the kings of Judah and Israel?

Now*p after the time that Amaziah did turn away from following the Lord*s they made a conspiracy against him in Jerusalem; and he fled to Lachish: but they sent to Lachish after him, and slew him there.
And*p they brought him upon horses, and buried him with his fathers in the city of Judah.
2 Chronicles 26
Then*p all the people of Judah took Uzziah, who was sixteen years old, and made him king in the room of his father Amaziah.
He*p built Eloth, and restored it to Judah, after that the king slept with his fathers.
Sixteen*p years old was Uzziah when he began to reign, and he reigned fifty and two years in Jerusalem. His mother's name also was Jecoliah of Jerusalem.
And*p he did that which was right in the sight of the Lord,*s according to all that his father Amaziah did.
And*p he sought God in the days of Zechariah, who had understanding in the visions of God: and as long as he sought the Lord,*s God made him to prosper.
And*p he went forth and warred against the Philistines, and brake down the wall of Gath, and the wall of Jabneh, and the wall of Ashdod, and built cities about Ashdod, and among the Philistines.
And*p God helped him against the Philistines, and against the Arabians that dwelt in Gurâ€“baal, and the Mehunims.
And*p the Ammonites gave gifts to Uzziah: and his name spread abroad even to the entering in of Egypt; for he strengthened himself exceedingly.
Moreover*p Uzziah built towers in Jerusalem at the corner gate, and at the valley gate, and at the turning of the wall, and fortified them.

Also*p he built towers in the desert, and digged many wells: for he had much cattle, both in the low country, and in the plains: husbandmen also, and vine dressers in the mountains, and in Carmel: for he loved husbandry.

Moreover*p Uzziah had an host of fighting men, that went out to war by bands, according to the number of their account by the hand of Jeiel the scribe and Maaseiah the ruler, under the hand of Hananiah, one of the king's captains.
The*p whole number of the chief of the fathers of the mighty men of valour were two thousand and six hundred.
And*p under their hand was an army, three hundred thousand and seven thousand and five hundred, that made war with mighty power, to help the king against the enemy.
And*p Uzziah prepared for them throughout all the host shields, and spears, and helmets, and habergeons, and bows, and slings to cast stones.

And*p he made in Jerusalem engines, invented by cunning men, to be on the towers and upon the bulwarks, to shoot arrows and great stones withal. And his name spread far abroad; for he was marvellously helped, till he was strong.
But*p when he was strong, his heart was lifted up to his destruction: for he transgressed against the Lord*s his God, and went into the temple of the Lord*s to burn incense upon the altar of incense.
And*p Azariah the priest went in after him, and with him fourscore priests of the Lord,*s that were valiant men:

And*p they withstood Uzziah the king, and said unto him, It appertaineth not unto thee, Uzziah, to burn incense unto the Lord,*s but to the priests the sons of Aaron, that are consecrated to burn incense: go out of the sanctuary; for thou hast trespassed; neither shall it be for thine honour from the Lord*s God.

Then*p Uzziah was wroth, and had a censer in his hand to burn incense: and while he was wroth with the priests, the leprosy even rose up in his forehead before the priests in the house of the Lord,*s from beside the incense altar.

And*p Azariah the chief priest, and all the priests, looked upon him, and, behold, he was leprous in his forehead, and they thrust him out from thence; yea, himself hasted also to go out, because the Lord*s had smitten him.

And*p Uzziah the king was a leper unto the day of his death, and dwelt in a several house, being a leper; for he was cut off from the house of the Lord:*s and Jotham his son was over the king's house, judging the people of the land.
Now*p the rest of the acts of Uzziah, first and last, did Isaiah the prophet, the son of Amoz, write.
So*p Uzziah slept with his fathers, and they buried him with his fathers in the field of the burial which belonged to the kings; for they said, He is a leper: and Jotham his son reigned in his stead.
2 Chronicles 27
Jotham*p was twenty and five years old when he began to reign, and he reigned sixteen years in Jerusalem. His mother's name also was Jerusha, the daughter of Zadok.
And*p he did that which was right in the sight of the Lord,*s according to all that his father Uzziah did: howbeit he entered not into the temple of the Lord.*s And the people did yet corruptly.
He*p built the high gate of the house of the Lord,*s and on the wall of Ophel he built much.
Moreover*p he built cities in the mountains of Judah, and in the forests he built castles and towers.

He*p fought also with the king of the Ammonites, and prevailed against them. And the children of Ammon gave him the same year an hundred talents of silver, and ten thousand measures of wheat, and ten thousand of barley. So much did the children of Ammon pay unto him, both the second year, and the third.
So*p Jotham became mighty, because he prepared his ways before the Lord*s his God.
Now*p the rest of the acts of Jotham, and all his wars, and his ways, lo, they are written in the book of the kings of Israel and Judah.
He*p was five and twenty years old when he began to reign, and reigned sixteen years in Jerusalem.
And*p Jotham slept with his fathers, and they buried him in the city of David: and Ahaz his son reigned in his stead.
2 Chronicles 28
Ahaz*p was twenty years old when he began to reign, and he reigned sixteen years in Jerusalem: but he did not that which was right in the sight of the Lord,*s like David his father:
For*p he walked in the ways of the kings of Israel, and made also molten images for Baalim.
Moreover*p he burnt incense in the valley of the son of Hinnom, and burnt his children in the fire, after the abominations of the heathen whom the Lord*s had cast out before the children of Israel.
He*p sacrificed also and burnt incense in the high places, and on the hills, and under every green tree.

Wherefore*p the Lord*s his God delivered him into the hand of the king of Syria; and they smote him, and carried away a great multitude of them captives, and brought them to Damascus. And he was also delivered into the hand of the king of Israel, who smote him with a great slaughter.
For*p Pekah the son of Remaliah slew in Judah an hundred and twenty thousand in one day, which were all valiant men; because they had forsaken the Lord*s God of their fathers.
And*p Zichri, a mighty man of Ephraim, slew Maaseiah the king's son, and Azrikam the governor of the house, and Elkanah that was next to the king.
And*p the children of Israel carried away captive of their brethren two hundred thousand, women, sons, and daughters, and took also away much spoil from them, and brought the spoil to Samaria.

But*p a prophet of the Lord*s was there, whose name was Oded: and he went out before the host that came to Samaria, and said unto them, Behold, because the Lord*s God of your fathers was wroth with Judah, he hath delivered them into your hand, and ye have slain them in a rage that reacheth up unto heaven.
And*p now ye purpose to keep under the children of Judah and Jerusalem for bondmen and bondwomen unto you: but are there not with you, even with you, sins against the Lord*s your God?
Now*p hear me therefore, and deliver the captives again, which ye have taken captive of your brethren: for the fierce wrath of the Lord*s is upon you.

Then*p certain of the heads of the children of Ephraim, Azariah the son of Johanan, Berechiah the son of Meshillemoth, and Jehizkiah the son of Shallum, and Amasa the son of Hadlai, stood up against them that came from the war,

And*p said unto them, Ye shall not bring in the captives hither: for whereas we have offended against the Lord*s already, ye intend to add more to our sins and to our trespass: for our trespass is great, and there is fierce wrath against Israel.
So*p the armed men left the captives and the spoil before the princes and all the congregation.

And*p the men which were expressed by name rose up, and took the captives, and with the spoil clothed all that were naked among them, and arrayed them, and shod them, and gave them to eat and to drink, and anointed them, and carried all the feeble of them upon asses, and brought them to Jericho, the city of palm trees, to their brethren: then they returned to Samaria.
At*p that time did king Ahaz send unto the kings of Assyria to help him.
For*p again the Edomites had come and smitten Judah, and carried away captives.

The*p Philistines also had invaded the cities of the low country, and of the south of Judah, and had taken Bethâ€“shemesh, and Aijalon, and Gederoth, and Soco with the villages thereof, and Timnah with the villages thereof, Gimzo also and the villages thereof: and they dwelt there.
For*p the Lord*s brought Judah low because of Ahaz king of Israel; for he made Judah naked, and transgressed sore against the Lord.*s
And*p Tilgathâ€“pilneser king of Assyria came unto him, and distressed him, but strengthened him not.
For*p Ahaz took away a portion out of the house of the Lord,*s and out of the house of the king, and of the princes, and gave it unto the king of Assyria: but he helped him not.
And*p in the time of his distress did he trespass yet more against the Lord:*s this is that king Ahaz.

For*p he sacrificed unto the gods of Damascus, which smote him: and he said, Because the gods of the kings of Syria help them, therefore will I sacrifice to them, that they may help me. But they were the ruin of him, and of all Israel.

And*p Ahaz gathered together the vessels of the house of God, and cut in pieces the vessels of the house of God, and shut up the doors of the house of the Lord,*s and he made him altars in every corner of Jerusalem.
And*p in every several city of Judah he made high places to burn incense unto other gods, and provoked to anger the Lord*s God of his fathers.
Now*p the rest of his acts and of all his ways, first and last, behold, they are written in the book of the kings of Judah and Israel.
And*p Ahaz slept with his fathers, and they buried him in the city, even in Jerusalem: but they brought him not into the sepulchres of the kings of Israel: and Hezekiah his son reigned in his stead.
2 Chronicles 29
Hezekiah*p began to reign when he was five and twenty years old, and he reigned nine and twenty years in Jerusalem. And his mother's name was Abijah, the daughter of Zechariah.
And*p he did that which was right in the sight of the Lord,*s according to all that David his father had done.
He*p in the first year of his reign, in the first month, opened the doors of the house of the Lord,*s and repaired them.
And*p he brought in the priests and the Levites, and gathered them together into the east street,
And*p said unto them, Hear me, ye Levites, sanctify now yourselves, and sanctify the house of the Lord*s God of your fathers, and carry forth the filthiness out of the holy place.

For*p our fathers have trespassed, and done that which was evil in the eyes of the Lord*s our God, and have forsaken him, and have turned away their faces from the habitation of the Lord,*s and turned their backs.
Also*p they have shut up the doors of the porch, and put out the lamps, and have not burned incense nor offered burnt offerings in the holy place unto the God of Israel.
Wherefore*p the wrath of the Lord*s was upon Judah and Jerusalem, and he hath delivered them to trouble, to astonishment, and to hissing, as ye see with your eyes.
For,*p lo, our fathers have fallen by the sword, and our sons and our daughters and our wives are in captivity for this.
Now*p it is in mine heart to make a covenant with the Lord*s God of Israel, that his fierce wrath may turn away from us.
My*p sons, be not now negligent: for the Lord*s hath chosen you to stand before him, to serve him, and that ye should minister unto him, and burn incense.

Then*p the Levites arose, Mahath the son of Amasai, and Joel the son of Azariah, of the sons of the Kohathites: and of the sons of Merari, Kish the son of Abdi, and Azariah the son of Jehalelel: and of the Gershonites; Joah the son of Zimmah, and Eden the son of Joah:
And*p of the sons of Elizaphan; Shimri, and Jeiel: and of the sons of Asaph; Zechariah, and Mattaniah:
And*p of the sons of Heman; Jehiel, and Shimei: and of the sons of Jeduthun; Shemaiah, and Uzziel.
And*p they gathered their brethren, and sanctified themselves, and came, according to the commandment of the king, by the words of the Lord,*s to cleanse the house of the Lord.*s

And*p the priests went into the inner part of the house of the Lord,*s to cleanse it, and brought out all the uncleanness that they found in the temple of the Lord*s into the court of the house of the Lord.*s And the Levites took it, to carry it out abroad into the brook Kidron.

Now*p they began on the first day of the first month to sanctify, and on the eighth day of the month came they to the porch of the Lord:*s so they sanctified the house of the Lord*s in eight days; and in the sixteenth day of the first month they made an end.

Then*p they went in to Hezekiah the king, and said, We have cleansed all the house of the Lord,*s and the altar of burnt offering, with all the vessels thereof, and the shewbread table, with all the vessels thereof.
Moreover*p all the vessels, which king Ahaz in his reign did cast away in his transgression, have we prepared and sanctified, and, behold, they are before the altar of the Lord.*s
Then*p Hezekiah the king rose early, and gathered the rulers of the city, and went up to the house of the Lord.*s

And*p they brought seven bullocks, and seven rams, and seven lambs, and seven he goats, for a sin offering for the kingdom, and for the sanctuary, and for Judah. And he commanded the priests the sons of Aaron to offer them on the altar of the Lord.*s

So*p they killed the bullocks, and the priests received the blood, and sprinkled it on the altar: likewise, when they had killed the rams, they sprinkled the blood upon the altar: they killed also the lambs, and they sprinkled the blood upon the altar.
And*p they brought forth the he goats for the sin offering before the king and the congregation; and they laid their hands upon them:

And*p the priests killed them, and they made reconciliation with their blood upon the altar, to make an atonement for all Israel: for the king commanded that the burnt offering and the sin offering should be made for all Israel.

And*p he set the Levites in the house of the Lord*s with cymbals, with psalteries, and with harps, according to the commandment of David, and of Gad the king's seer, and Nathan the prophet: for so was the commandment of the Lord*s by his prophets.
And*p the Levites stood with the instruments of David, and the priests with the trumpets.

And*p Hezekiah commanded to offer the burnt offering upon the altar. And when the burnt offering began, the song of the Lord*s began also with the trumpets, and with the instruments ordained by David king of Israel.
And*p all the congregation worshipped, and the singers sang, and the trumpeters sounded: and all this continued until the burnt offering was finished.
And*p when they had made an end of offering, the king and all that were present with him bowed themselves, and worshipped.

Moreover*p Hezekiah the king and the princes commanded the Levites to sing praise unto the Lord*s with the words of David, and of Asaph the seer. And they sang praises with gladness, and they bowed their heads and worshipped.

Then*p Hezekiah answered and said, Now ye have consecrated yourselves unto the Lord,*s come near and bring sacrifices and thank offerings into the house of the Lord.*s And the congregation brought in sacrifices and thank offerings; and as many as were of a free heart burnt offerings.
And*p the number of the burnt offerings, which the congregation brought, was threescore and ten bullocks, an hundred rams, and two hundred lambs: all these were for a burnt offering to the Lord.*s
And*p the consecrated things were six hundred oxen and three thousand sheep.

But*p the priests were too few, so that they could not flay all the burnt offerings: wherefore their brethren the Levites did help them, till the work was ended, and until the other priests had sanctified themselves: for the Levites were more upright in heart to sanctify themselves than the priests.
And*p also the burnt offerings were in abundance, with the fat of the peace offerings, and the drink offerings for every burnt offering. So the service of the house of the Lord*s was set in order.
And*p Hezekiah rejoiced, and all the people, that God had prepared the people: for the thing was done suddenly.
2 Chronicles 30

And*p Hezekiah sent to all Israel and Judah, and wrote letters also to Ephraim and Manasseh, that they should come to the house of the Lord*s at Jerusalem, to keep the passover unto the Lord*s God of Israel.
For*p the king had taken counsel, and his princes, and all the congregation in Jerusalem, to keep the passover in the second month.
For*p they could not keep it at that time, because the priests had not sanctified themselves sufficiently, neither had the people gathered themselves together to Jerusalem.
And*p the thing pleased the king and all the congregation.

So*p they established a decree to make proclamation throughout all Israel, from Beerâ€“sheba even to Dan, that they should come to keep the passover unto the Lord*s God of Israel at Jerusalem: for they had not done it of a long time in such sort as it was written.

So*p the posts went with the letters from the king and his princes throughout all Israel and Judah, and according to the commandment of the king, saying, Ye children of Israel, turn again unto the Lord*s God of Abraham, Isaac, and Israel, and he will return to the remnant of you, that are escaped out of the hand of the kings of Assyria.
And*p be not ye like your fathers, and like your brethren, which trespassed against the Lord*s God of their fathers, who therefore gave them up to desolation, as ye see.

Now*p be ye not stiffnecked, as your fathers were, but yield yourselves unto the Lord,*s and enter into his sanctuary, which he hath sanctified for ever: and serve the Lord*s your God, that the fierceness of his wrath may turn away from you.

For*p if ye turn again unto the Lord,*s your brethren and your children shall find compassion before them that lead them captive, so that they shall come again into this land: for the Lord*s your God is gracious and merciful, and will not turn away his face from you, if ye return unto him.
So*p the posts passed from city to city through the country of Ephraim and Manasseh even unto Zebulun: but they laughed them to scorn, and mocked them.
Nevertheless*p divers of Asher and Manasseh and of Zebulun humbled themselves, and came to Jerusalem.
Also*p in Judah the hand of God was to give them one heart to do the commandment of the king and of the princes, by the word of the Lord.*s
And*p there assembled at Jerusalem much people to keep the feast of unleavened bread in the second month, a very great congregation.
And*p they arose and took away the altars that were in Jerusalem, and all the altars for incense took they away, and cast them into the brook Kidron.

Then*p they killed the passover on the fourteenth day of the second month: and the priests and the Levites were ashamed, and sanctified themselves, and brought in the burnt offerings into the house of the Lord.*s
And*p they stood in their place after their manner, according to the law of Moses the man of God: the priests sprinkled the blood, which they received of the hand of the Levites.

For*p there were many in the congregation that were not sanctified: therefore the Levites had the charge of the killing of the passovers for every one that was not clean, to sanctify them unto the Lord.*s

For*p a multitude of the people, even many of Ephraim, and Manasseh, Issachar, and Zebulun, had not cleansed themselves, yet did they eat the passover otherwise than it was written. But Hezekiah prayed for them, saying, The good Lord*s pardon every one
That*p prepareth his heart to seek God, the Lord*s God of his fathers, though he be not cleansed according to the purification of the sanctuary.
And*p the Lord*s hearkened to Hezekiah, and healed the people.

And*p the children of Israel that were present at Jerusalem kept the feast of unleavened bread seven days with great gladness: and the Levites and the priests praised the Lord*s day by day, singing with loud instruments unto the Lord.*s

And*p Hezekiah spake comfortably unto all the Levites that taught the good knowledge of the Lord:*s and they did eat throughout the feast seven days, offering peace offerings, and making confession to the Lord*s God of their fathers.
And*p the whole assembly took counsel to keep other seven days: and they kept other seven days with gladness.

For*p Hezekiah king of Judah did give to the congregation a thousand bullocks and seven thousand sheep; and the princes gave to the congregation a thousand bullocks and ten thousand sheep: and a great number of priests sanctified themselves.

And*p all the congregation of Judah, with the priests and the Levites, and all the congregation that came out of Israel, and the strangers that came out of the land of Israel, and that dwelt in Judah, rejoiced.
So*p there was great joy in Jerusalem: for since the time of Solomon the son of David king of Israel there was not the like in Jerusalem.
Then*p the priests the Levites arose and blessed the people: and their voice was heard, and their prayer came up to his holy dwelling place, even unto heaven.
2 Chronicles 31

Now*p when all this was finished, all Israel that were present went out to the cities of Judah, and brake the images in pieces, and cut down the groves, and threw down the high places and the altars out of all Judah and Benjamin, in Ephraim also and Manasseh, until they had utterly destroyed them all. Then all the children of Israel returned, every man to his possession, into their own cities.

And*p Hezekiah appointed the courses of the priests and the Levites after their courses, every man according to his service, the priests and Levites for burnt offerings and for peace offerings, to minister, and to give thanks, and to praise in the gates of the tents of the Lord.*s

He*p appointed also the king's portion of his substance for the burnt offerings, to wit, for the morning and evening burnt offerings, and the burnt offerings for the sabbaths, and for the new moons, and for the set feasts, as it is written in the law of the Lord.*s
Moreover*p he commanded the people that dwelt in Jerusalem to give the portion of the priests and the Levites, that they might be encouraged in the law of the Lord.*s

And*p as soon as the commandment came abroad, the children of Israel brought in abundance the firstfruits of corn, wine, and oil, and honey, and of all the increase of the field; and the tithe of all things brought they in abundantly.

And*p concerning the children of Israel and Judah, that dwelt in the cities of Judah, they also brought in the tithe of oxen and sheep, and the tithe of holy things which were consecrated unto the Lord*s their God, and laid them by heaps.
In*p the third month they began to lay the foundation of the heaps, and finished them in the seventh month.
And*p when Hezekiah and the princes came and saw the heaps, they blessed the Lord,*s and his people Israel.
Then*p Hezekiah questioned with the priests and the Levites concerning the heaps.

And*p Azariah the chief priest of the house of Zadok answered him, and said, Since the people began to bring the offerings into the house of the Lord,*s we have had enough to eat, and have left plenty: for the Lord*s hath blessed his people; and that which is left is this great store.
Then*p Hezekiah commanded to prepare chambers in the house of the Lord;*s and they prepared them,
And*p brought in the offerings and the tithes and the dedicated things faithfully: over which Cononiah the Levite was ruler, and Shimei his brother was the next.

And*p Jehiel, and Azaziah, and Nahath, and Asahel, and Jerimoth, and Jozabad, and Eliel, and Ismachiah, and Mahath, and Benaiah, were overseers under the hand of Cononiah and Shimei his brother, at the commandment of Hezekiah the king, and Azariah the ruler of the house of God.
And*p Kore the son of Imnah the Levite, the porter toward the east, was over the freewill offerings of God, to distribute the oblations of the Lord,*s and the most holy things.

And*p next him were Eden, and Miniamin, and Jeshua, and Shemaiah, Amariah, and Shecaniah, in the cities of the priests, in their set office, to give to their brethren by courses, as well to the great as to the small:

Beside*p their genealogy of males, from three years old and upward, even unto every one that entereth into the house of the Lord,*s his daily portion for their service in their charges according to their courses;
Both*p to the genealogy of the priests by the house of their fathers, and the Levites from twenty years old and upward, in their charges by their courses;
And*p to the genealogy of all their little ones, their wives, and their sons, and their daughters, through all the congregation: for in their set office they sanctified themselves in holiness:

Also*p of the sons of Aaron the priests, which were in the fields of the suburbs of their cities, in every several city, the men that were expressed by name, to give portions to all the males among the priests, and to all that were reckoned by genealogies among the Levites.
And*p thus did Hezekiah throughout all Judah, and wrought that which was good and right and truth before the Lord*s his God.
And*p in every work that he began in the service of the house of God, and in the law, and in the commandments, to seek his God, he did it with all his heart, and prospered.
2 Chronicles 32
After*p these things, and the establishment thereof, Sennacherib king of Assyria came, and entered into Judah, and encamped against the fenced cities, and thought to win them for himself.
And*p when Hezekiah saw that Sennacherib was come, and that he was purposed to fight against Jerusalem,
He*p took counsel with his princes and his mighty men to stop the waters of the fountains which were without the city: and they did help him.
So*p there was gathered much people together, who stopped all the fountains, and the brook that ran through the midst of the land, saying, Why should the kings of Assyria come, and find much water?

Also*p he strengthened himself, and built up all the wall that was broken, and raised it up to the towers, and another wall without, and repaired Millo in the city of David, and made darts and shields in abundance.
And*p he set captains of war over the people, and gathered them together to him in the street of the gate of the city, and spake comfortably to them, saying,
Be*p strong and courageous, be not afraid nor dismayed for the king of Assyria, nor for all the multitude that is with him: for there be more with us than with him:
With*p him is an arm of flesh; but with us is the Lord*s our God to help us, and to fight our battles. And the people rested themselves upon the words of Hezekiah king of Judah.

After*p this did Sennacherib king of Assyria send his servants to Jerusalem, (but he himself laid siege against Lachish, and all his power with him,) unto Hezekiah king of Judah, and unto all Judah that were at Jerusalem, saying,
Thus*p saith Sennacherib king of Assyria, Whereon do ye trust, that ye abide in the siege in Jerusalem?
Doth*p not Hezekiah persuade you to give over yourselves to die by famine and by thirst, saying, The Lord*s our God shall deliver us out of the hand of the king of Assyria?
Hath*p not the same Hezekiah taken away his high places and his altars, and commanded Judah and Jerusalem, saying, Ye shall worship before one altar, and burn incense upon it?
Know*p ye not what I and my fathers have done unto all the people of other lands? were the gods of the nations of those lands any ways able to deliver their lands out of mine hand?
Who*p was there among all the gods of those nations that my fathers utterly destroyed, that could deliver his people out of mine hand, that your God should be able to deliver you out of mine hand?

Now*p therefore let not Hezekiah deceive you, nor persuade you on this manner, neither yet believe him: for no god of any nation or kingdom was able to deliver his people out of mine hand, and out of the hand of my fathers: how much less shall your God deliver you out of mine hand?
And*p his servants spake yet more against the Lord*s God, and against his servant Hezekiah.

He*p wrote also letters to rail on the Lord*s God of Israel, and to speak against him, saying, As the gods of the nations of other lands have not delivered their people out of mine hand, so shall not the God of Hezekiah deliver his people out of mine hand.
Then*p they cried with a loud voice in the Jews' speech unto the people of Jerusalem that were on the wall, to affright them, and to trouble them; that they might take the city.
And*p they spake against the God of Jerusalem, as against the gods of the people of the earth, which were the work of the hands of man.
And*p for this cause Hezekiah the king, and the prophet Isaiah the son of Amoz, prayed and cried to heaven.

And*p the Lord*s sent an angel, which cut off all the mighty men of valour, and the leaders and captains in the camp of the king of Assyria. So he returned with shame of face to his own land. And when he was come into the house of his god, they that came forth of his own bowels slew him there with the sword.
Thus*p the Lord*s saved Hezekiah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem from the hand of Sennacherib the king of Assyria, and from the hand of all other, and guided them on every side.
And*p many brought gifts unto the Lord*s to Jerusalem, and presents to Hezekiah king of Judah: so that he was magnified in the sight of all nations from thenceforth.
In*p those days Hezekiah was sick to the death, and prayed unto the Lord:*s and he spake unto him, and he gave him a sign.
But*p Hezekiah rendered not again according to the benefit done unto him; for his heart was lifted up: therefore there was wrath upon him, and upon Judah and Jerusalem.
Notwithstanding*p Hezekiah humbled himself for the pride of his heart, both he and the inhabitants of Jerusalem, so that the wrath of the Lord*s came not upon them in the days of Hezekiah.

And*p Hezekiah had exceeding much riches and honour: and he made himself treasuries for silver, and for gold, and for precious stones, and for spices, and for shields, and for all manner of pleasant jewels;
Storehouses*p also for the increase of corn, and wine, and oil; and stalls for all manner of beasts, and cotes for flocks.
Moreover*p he provided him cities, and possessions of flocks and herds in abundance: for God had given him substance very much.
This*p same Hezekiah also stopped the upper watercourse of Gihon, and brought it straight down to the west side of the city of David. And Hezekiah prospered in all his works.

Howbeit*p in the business of the ambassadors of the princes of Babylon, who sent unto him to enquire of the wonder that was done in the land, God left him, to try him, that he might know all that was in his heart.
Now*p the rest of the acts of Hezekiah, and his goodness, behold, they are written in the vision of Isaiah the prophet, the son of Amoz, and in the book of the kings of Judah and Israel.

And*p Hezekiah slept with his fathers, and they buried him in the chiefest of the sepulchres of the sons of David: and all Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem did him honour at his death. And Manasseh his son reigned in his stead.
2 Chronicles 33
Manasseh*p was twelve years old when he began to reign, and he reigned fifty and five years in Jerusalem:
But*p did that which was evil in the sight of the Lord,*s like unto the abominations of the heathen, whom the Lord*s had cast out before the children of Israel.
For*p he built again the high places which Hezekiah his father had broken down, and he reared up altars for Baalim, and made groves, and worshipped all the host of heaven, and served them.
Also*p he built altars in the house of the Lord,*s whereof the Lord*s had said, In Jerusalem shall my name be for ever.
And*p he built altars for all the host of heaven in the two courts of the house of the Lord.*s

And*p he caused his children to pass through the fire in the valley of the son of Hinnom: also he observed times, and used enchantments, and used witchcraft, and dealt with a familiar spirit, and with wizards: he wrought much evil in the sight of the Lord,*s to provoke him to anger.

And*p he set a carved image, the idol which he had made, in the house of God, of which God had said to David and to Solomon his son, In this house, and in Jerusalem, which I have chosen before all the tribes of Israel, will I put my name for ever:

Neither*p will I any more remove the foot of Israel from out of the land which I have appointed for your fathers; so that they will take heed to do all that I have commanded them, according to the whole law and the statutes and the ordinances by the hand of Moses.
So*p Manasseh made Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem to err, and to do worse than the heathen, whom the Lord*s had destroyed before the children of Israel.
And*p the Lord*s spake to Manasseh, and to his people: but they would not hearken.
Wherefore*p the Lord*s brought upon them the captains of the host of the king of Assyria, which took Manasseh among the thorns, and bound him with fetters, and carried him to Babylon.
And*p when he was in affliction, he besought the Lord*s his God, and humbled himself greatly before the God of his fathers,
And*p prayed unto him: and he was entreated of him, and heard his supplication, and brought him again to Jerusalem into his kingdom. Then Manasseh knew that the Lord*s he was God.

Now*p after this he built a wall without the city of David, on the west side of Gihon, in the valley, even to the entering in at the fish gate, and compassed about Ophel, and raised it up a very great height, and put captains of war in all the fenced cities of Judah.

And*p he took away the strange gods, and the idol out of the house of the Lord,*s and all the altars that he had built in the mount of the house of the Lord,*s and in Jerusalem, and cast them out of the city.
And*p he repaired the altar of the Lord,*s and sacrificed thereon peace offerings and thank offerings, and commanded Judah to serve the Lord*s God of Israel.
Nevertheless*p the people did sacrifice still in the high places, yet unto the Lord*s their God only.

Now*p the rest of the acts of Manasseh, and his prayer unto his God, and the words of the seers that spake to him in the name of the Lord*s God of Israel, behold, they are written in the book of the kings of Israel.

His*p prayer also, and how God was entreated of him, and all his sin, and his trespass, and the places wherein he built high places, and set up groves and graven images, before he was humbled: behold, they are written among the sayings of the seers.
So*p Manasseh slept with his fathers, and they buried him in his own house: and Amon his son reigned in his stead.
Amon*p was two and twenty years old when he began to reign, and reigned two years in Jerusalem.
But*p he did that which was evil in the sight of the Lord,*s as did Manasseh his father: for Amon sacrificed unto all the carved images which Manasseh his father had made, and served them;
And*p humbled not himself before the Lord,*s as Manasseh his father had humbled himself; but Amon trespassed more and more.
And*p his servants conspired against him, and slew him in his own house.
But*p the people of the land slew all them that had conspired against king Amon; and the people of the land made Josiah his son king in his stead.
2 Chronicles 34
Josiah*p was eight years old when he began to reign, and he reigned in Jerusalem one and thirty years.
And*p he did that which was right in the sight of the Lord,*s and walked in the ways of David his father, and declined neither to the right hand, nor to the left.

For*p in the eighth year of his reign, while he was yet young, he began to seek after the God of David his father: and in the twelfth year he began to purge Judah and Jerusalem from the high places, and the groves, and the carved images, and the molten images.

And*p they brake down the altars of Baalim in his presence; and the images, that were on high above them, he cut down; and the groves, and the carved images, and the molten images, he brake in pieces, and made dust of them, and strowed it upon the graves of them that had sacrificed unto them.
And*p he burnt the bones of the priests upon their altars, and cleansed Judah and Jerusalem.
And*p so did he in the cities of Manasseh, and Ephraim, and Simeon, even unto Naphtali, with their mattocks round about.
And*p when he had broken down the altars and the groves, and had beaten the graven images into powder, and cut down all the idols throughout all the land of Israel, he returned to Jerusalem.

Now*p in the eighteenth year of his reign, when he had purged the land, and the house, he sent Shaphan the son of Azaliah, and Maaseiah the governor of the city, and Joah the son of Joahaz the recorder, to repair the house of the Lord*s his God.

And*p when they came to Hilkiah the high priest, they delivered the money that was brought into the house of God, which the Levites that kept the doors had gathered of the hand of Manasseh and Ephraim, and of all the remnant of Israel, and of all Judah and Benjamin; and they returned to Jerusalem.
And*p they put it in the hand of the workmen that had the oversight of the house of the Lord,*s and they gave it to the workmen that wrought in the house of the Lord,*s to repair and amend the house:
Even*p to the artificers and builders gave they it, to buy hewn stone, and timber for couplings, and to floor the houses which the kings of Judah had destroyed.

And*p the men did the work faithfully: and the overseers of them were Jahath and Obadiah, the Levites, of the sons of Merari; and Zechariah and Meshullam, of the sons of the Kohathites, to set it forward; and other of the Levites, all that could skill of instruments of musick.
Also*p they were over the bearers of burdens, and were overseers of all that wrought the work in any manner of service: and of the Levites there were scribes, and officers, and porters.
And*p when they brought out the money that was brought into the house of the Lord,*s Hilkiah the priest found a book of the law of the Lord*s given by Moses.
And*p Hilkiah answered and said to Shaphan the scribe, I have found the book of the law in the house of the Lord.*s And Hilkiah delivered the book to Shaphan.
And*p Shaphan carried the book to the king, and brought the king word back again, saying, All that was committed to thy servants, they do it.
And*p they have gathered together the money that was found in the house of the Lord,*s and have delivered it into the hand of the overseers, and to the hand of the workmen.
Then*p Shaphan the scribe told the king, saying, Hilkiah the priest hath given me a book. And Shaphan read it before the king.
And*p it came to pass, when the king had heard the words of the law, that he rent his clothes.
And*p the king commanded Hilkiah, and Ahikam the son of Shaphan, and Abdon the son of Micah, and Shaphan the scribe, and Asaiah a servant of the king's, saying,

Go,*p enquire of the Lord*s for me, and for them that are left in Israel and in Judah, concerning the words of the book that is found: for great is the wrath of the Lord*s that is poured out upon us, because our fathers have not kept the word of the Lord,*s to do after all that is written in this book.

And*p Hilkiah, and they that the king had appointed, went to Huldah the prophetess, the wife of Shallum the son of Tikvath, the son of Hasrah, keeper of the wardrobe; (now she dwelt in Jerusalem in the college:) and they spake to her to that effect.
And*p she answered them, Thus saith the Lord*s God of Israel, Tell ye the man that sent you to me,
Thus*p saith the Lord,*s Behold, I will bring evil upon this place, and upon the inhabitants thereof, even all the curses that are written in the book which they have read before the king of Judah:

Because*p they have forsaken me, and have burned incense unto other gods, that they might provoke me to anger with all the works of their hands; therefore my wrath shall be poured out upon this place, and shall not be quenched.
And*p as for the king of Judah, who sent you to enquire of the Lord,*s so shall ye say unto him, Thus saith the Lord*s God of Israel concerning the words which thou hast heard;

Because*p thine heart was tender, and thou didst humble thyself before God, when thou heardest his words against this place, and against the inhabitants thereof, and humbledst thyself before me, and didst rend thy clothes, and weep before me; I have even heard thee also, saith the Lord.*s

Behold,*p I will gather thee to thy fathers, and thou shalt be gathered to thy grave in peace, neither shall thine eyes see all the evil that I will bring upon this place, and upon the inhabitants of the same. So they brought the king word again.
Then*p the king sent and gathered together all the elders of Judah and Jerusalem.

And*p the king went up into the house of the Lord,*s and all the men of Judah, and the inhabitants of Jerusalem, and the priests, and the Levites, and all the people, great and small: and he read in their ears all the words of the book of the covenant that was found in the house of the Lord.*s

And*p the king stood in his place, and made a covenant before the Lord,*s to walk after the Lord,*s and to keep his commandments, and his testimonies, and his statutes, with all his heart, and with all his soul, to perform the words of the covenant which are written in this book.
And*p he caused all that were present in Jerusalem and Benjamin to stand to it. And the inhabitants of Jerusalem did according to the covenant of God, the God of their fathers.

And*p Josiah took away all the abominations out of all the countries that pertained to the children of Israel, and made all that were present in Israel to serve, even to serve the Lord*s their God. And all his days they departed not from following the Lord,*s the God of their fathers.
2 Chronicles 35
Moreover*p Josiah kept a passover unto the Lord*s in Jerusalem: and they killed the passover on the fourteenth day of the first month.
And*p he set the priests in their charges, and encouraged them to the service of the house of the Lord,*s

And*p said unto the Levites that taught all Israel, which were holy unto the Lord,*s Put the holy ark in the house which Solomon the son of David king of Israel did build; it shall not be a burden upon your shoulders: serve now the Lord*s your God, and his people Israel,
And*p prepare yourselves by the houses of your fathers, after your courses, according to the writing of David king of Israel, and according to the writing of Solomon his son.
And*p stand in the holy place according to the divisions of the families of the fathers of your brethren the people, and after the division of the families of the Levites.
So*p kill the passover, and sanctify yourselves, and prepare your brethren, that they may do according to the word of the Lord*s by the hand of Moses.

And*p Josiah gave to the people, of the flock, lambs and kids, all for the passover offerings, for all that were present, to the number of thirty thousand, and three thousand bullocks: these were of the king's substance.

And*p his princes gave willingly unto the people, to the priests, and to the Levites: Hilkiah and Zechariah and Jehiel, rulers of the house of God, gave unto the priests for the passover offerings two thousand and six hundred small cattle, and three hundred oxen.

Conaniah*p also, and Shemaiah and Nethaneel, his brethren, and Hashabiah and Jeiel and Jozabad, chief of the Levites, gave unto the Levites for passover offerings five thousand small cattle, and five hundred oxen.
So*p the service was prepared, and the priests stood in their place, and the Levites in their courses, according to the king's commandment.
And*p they killed the passover, and the priests sprinkled the blood from their hands, and the Levites flayed them.

And*p they removed the burnt offerings, that they might give according to the divisions of the families of the people, to offer unto the Lord,*s as it is written in the book of Moses. And so did they with the oxen.
And*p they roasted the passover with fire according to the ordinance: but the other holy offerings sod they in pots, and in caldrons, and in pans, and divided them speedily among all the people.

And*p afterward they made ready for themselves, and for the priests: because the priests the sons of Aaron were busied in offering of burnt offerings and the fat until night; therefore the Levites prepared for themselves, and for the priests the sons of Aaron.

And*p the singers the sons of Asaph were in their place, according to the commandment of David, and Asaph, and Heman, and Jeduthun the king's seer; and the porters waited at every gate; they might not depart from their service; for their brethren the Levites prepared for them.
So*p all the service of the Lord*s was prepared the same day, to keep the passover, and to offer burnt offerings upon the altar of the Lord,*s according to the commandment of king Josiah.
And*p the children of Israel that were present kept the passover at that time, and the feast of unleavened bread seven days.

And*p there was no passover like to that kept in Israel from the days of Samuel the prophet; neither did all the kings of Israel keep such a passover as Josiah kept, and the priests, and the Levites, and all Judah and Israel that were present, and the inhabitants of Jerusalem.
In*p the eighteenth year of the reign of Josiah was this passover kept.
After*p all this, when Josiah had prepared the temple, Neco king of Egypt came up to fight against Carchemish by Euphrates: and Josiah went out against him.

But*p he sent ambassadors to him, saying, What have I to do with thee, thou king of Judah? I come not against thee this day, but against the house wherewith I have war: for God commanded me to make haste: forbear thee from meddling with God, who is with me, that he destroy thee not.

Nevertheless*p Josiah would not turn his face from him, but disguised himself, that he might fight with him, and hearkened not unto the words of Neco from the mouth of God, and came to fight in the valley of Megiddo.
And*p the archers shot at king Josiah; and the king said to his servants, Have me away; for I am sore wounded.

His*p servants therefore took him out of that chariot, and put him in the second chariot that he had; and they brought him to Jerusalem, and he died, and was buried in one of the sepulchres of his fathers. And all Judah and Jerusalem mourned for Josiah.

And*p Jeremiah lamented for Josiah: and all the singing men and the singing women spake of Josiah in their lamentations to this day, and made them an ordinance in Israel: and, behold, they are written in the lamentations.
Now*p the rest of the acts of Josiah, and his goodness, according to that which was written in the law of the Lord,*s
And*p his deeds, first and last, behold, they are written in the book of the kings of Israel and Judah.
2 Chronicles 36
Then*p the people of the land took Jehoahaz the son of Josiah, and made him king in his father's stead in Jerusalem.
Jehoahaz*p was twenty and three years old when he began to reign, and he reigned three months in Jerusalem.
And*p the king of Egypt put him down at Jerusalem, and condemned the land in an hundred talents of silver and a talent of gold.
And*p the king of Egypt made Eliakim his brother king over Judah and Jerusalem, and turned his name to Jehoiakim. And Neco took Jehoahaz his brother, and carried him to Egypt.
Jehoiakim*p was twenty and five years old when he began to reign, and he reigned eleven years in Jerusalem: and he did that which was evil in the sight of the Lord*s his God.
Against*p him came up Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, and bound him in fetters, to carry him to Babylon.
Nebuchadnezzar*p also carried of the vessels of the house of the Lord*s to Babylon, and put them in his temple at Babylon.

Now*p the rest of the acts of Jehoiakim, and his abominations which he did, and that which was found in him, behold, they are written in the book of the kings of Israel and Judah: and Jehoiachin his son reigned in his stead.
Jehoiachin*p was eight years old when he began to reign, and he reigned three months and ten days in Jerusalem: and he did that which was evil in the sight of the Lord.*s
And*p when the year was expired, king Nebuchadnezzar sent, and brought him to Babylon, with the goodly vessels of the house of the Lord,*s and made Zedekiah his brother king over Judah and Jerusalem.
Zedekiah*p was one and twenty years old when he began to reign, and reigned eleven years in Jerusalem.
And*p he did that which was evil in the sight of the Lord*s his God, and humbled not himself before Jeremiah the prophet speaking from the mouth of the Lord.*s
And*p he also rebelled against king Nebuchadnezzar, who had made him swear by God: but he stiffened his neck, and hardened his heart from turning unto the Lord*s God of Israel.
Moreover*p all the chief of the priests, and the people, transgressed very much after all the abominations of the heathen; and polluted the house of the Lord*s which he had hallowed in Jerusalem.
And*p the Lord*s God of their fathers sent to them by his messengers, rising up betimes, and sending; because he had compassion on his people, and on his dwelling place:
But*p they mocked the messengers of God, and despised his words, and misused his prophets, until the wrath of the Lord*s arose against his people, till there was no remedy.

Therefore*p he brought upon them the king of the Chaldeans, who slew their young men with the sword in the house of their sanctuary, and had no compassion upon young man or maiden, old man, or him that stooped for age: he gave them all into his hand.
And*p all the vessels of the house of God, great and small, and the treasures of the house of the Lord,*s and the treasures of the king, and of his princes; all these he brought to Babylon.
And*p they burnt the house of God, and brake down the wall of Jerusalem, and burnt all the palaces thereof with fire, and destroyed all the goodly vessels thereof.
And*p them that had escaped from the sword carried he away to Babylon; where they were servants to him and his sons until the reign of the kingdom of Persia:
To*p fulfil the word of the Lord*s by the mouth of Jeremiah, until the land had enjoyed her sabbaths: for as long as she lay desolate she kept sabbath, to fulfil threescore and ten years.

Now*p in the first year of Cyrus king of Persia, that the word of the Lord*s spoken by the mouth of Jeremiah might be accomplished, the Lord*s stirred up the spirit of Cyrus king of Persia, that he made a proclamation throughout all his kingdom, and put it also in writing, saying,

Thus*p saith Cyrus king of Persia, All the kingdoms of the earth hath the Lord*s God of heaven given me; and he hath charged me to build him an house in Jerusalem, which is in Judah. Who is there among you of all his people? The Lord*s his God be with him, and let him go up.
